From the distant reaches of the Crucible, beyond the Diremouth and even the Great Glass Desert, come the mysterious Geistoids. Awakened by a malevolent energy and driven by the bitterness of forgotten and discarded things, they seek revenge on all that has endured and been preserved. Constantly replenished from the remnants of civilization, the Geistoid horde poses a serious threat to the inhabitants of the Crucible.

KeyForge: Grim Reminders is the seventh set for KeyForge, introducing 250 new cards, including the new House Geistoid as well as entirely new effects, symbols, and more.

KeyForge, designed by Richard Garfield, stands out from any other card game in that each purchased deck is completely unique and ready to play right out of the box.

Authors: Sheila Santos, Israel Cendrero
Illustrator: Cristina Achaui
Publisher: Combo Games
Vendor: Combo Games
Release date:11/2024
Playing Age:6 and up
Number of players:2 - 4
Retail price:15 €
Playing time:15 minutes
Theme or setting:90's Cartoons

You are a talented group of animators looking for a job, and you have reached the last test in the recruiting process of the prestigious Cheesetoon Network studio. However, if you want to get the single vacancy in the company, you will have to compete to determine who is able to create the perfect frames in the best animation sequences.
In Keyframes, you will have 3 rounds to prove that you deserve the vacancy. To achieve this, each one will have a hand of frames (cards) and another 5 frames will be placed in the center of the table. In each turn you must play a card from your hand, which you will reveal simultaneously to determine the turn order of the next phase. In this second phase, we will build sequences by selecting one of the available frames, among which will be those used from the players' hand to determine the turn order. But pay attention! You can only have 2 projects open at the same time on your work table, and the sequence you add must be correlative with the ones you have, moreover, you can only add it if it is the prior or subsequent frame form the one you were working on previously. If it is not possible to add it following this rule, you must close your current project to start a new one, which will penalize you in the final scoring. If you are able to make more and better sequences than your rivals, the job will be yours!
Keyframes is a game created by the acclaimed Shei S. and Isra C., creators of titles such as The Red Cathedral, The White Castle, Shinkansen: Zero-Kei,1987 Channel Tunnel, Ramen... among a good handful of other great games, and illustrated by the amazing animation artist Cristina Achaui. Keyframes is a “filler” with very simple rules, which combines turn order bidding with a restrictive set collection which will force you, each turn, to calculate the best time to play which card, and which card to add to your sequences.

A game of Keyframes takes about 15 minutes to play, and can be played with 2 or 3 people individually, or 4 with a special 2 vs. 2 team system.

Embark on a mesmerizing journey through Kyoto's quaint streets, where locals and tourists wear traditional kimonos, immersing themselves in the city's timeless charm. As a budding photographer enchanted by the beauty of kimonos, you traverse the streets, seeking permission to capture these elegant figures. Strategize and outmaneuver your opponents to secure the best photo opportunities in this vibrant scene. With captivating glimpses of kimono-clad beauties, create cherished memories to treasure forever.

Kimono Memories is a two player competitive game where players draft cards from a rotating board to place in their own album pyramids. The goal is to collect the most kimono-clad beauties with matching patterns to gain the highest influence.

As night falls on Tokyo, two massive silhouettes rise from the smoke snaking up from destroyed skyscrapers. There can be only one who will be crowned King of Tokyo, either by annihilating their rival or by inspiring terror and awe from the crowds.

King of Tokyo Duel is a two-player tug-of-war dice game in the King of Tokyo line. Choose your uniquely-powered monster and roll new dice to draw the fame and destruction tokens toward you...or smash your rival with new special power cards to become the ultimate King of Tokyo!

Author: Richard Garfield
Illustrator: Régis Torres
Publisher: IELLO
Release date:05/2024
Playing Age:9 and up

Playing time:30 minutes
Theme or setting:Monsters, Kaijus, Tokyo, Japan

King of Tokyo: Origins is a standalone game in the King of Tokyo series that's meant to serve as an entry point for new players since it's a smaller, more affordable package. The game includes four new monsters, an assortment of new power cards mixed with older ones, energy cubes, and green dice with yellow characters.

Gameplay remains the same as in the original game: To win, be the first to score 20 points or be the only creature still standing.

On a turn, roll six dice, which show the following six symbols: 1, 2, or 3 points, energy, heal, and attack. Over three successive throws, choose whether to keep or discard each die in order to win points, gain energy, restore health, or attack other players. When you attack, if you're outside Tokyo, you hit whoever is in Tokyo; if you're in Tokyo, you hit everyone else! If someone's health drops to 0, they're out of the game. (You can't heal damage while in Tokyo, and the only way to leave town is to have someone attack you...which might put you at death's door.)

When you gain energy, you store it in cubes, which you can use to purchase power cards, which have a permanent or temporary effect.

Author: Derek Croxton
Illustrator: Rod Rodrigues
Publisher: Play to Z
Release date:09/2024
Playing Age:8 and up
Number of players:2 - 5
Retail price:20 €

Try to make the highest scoring 7 card hand for the best coalition.

In 6 rounds, you will maximize your hand to meet as many Bonus requirements as possible while also trying to create Sets and/or Sequences. Bonuses can range from not having a particular class in hand while having multiples of another class. Or having more of a class  than other classes. Bonus decrease in value as the game comes to an end: the first bonus is worth 30 points while the last one is worth 10 points.

Games last around 15-20 minutes. A small card game that is reminsicent of Fantasy Realms.

Publisher: FryxGames

Kingdom Legacy is a solo deck-builder that let the player build his/her own medieval kingdom. You start out with a deck of just 10 cards that will expand during the campaign, and many of the cards in the game will only be accessed depending on the choices made by the player.
Many of the cards may be upgraded up to 3 times by rotating the card to new orientations.

Kingdom Legacy is the world’s smallest legacy game that offers around 6 or more hours of exploration delight, and many expansions will offer the player to continue the adventure they have with their kingdom…

Authors: Andrea Chiarvesio, Luca Iennaco
Illustrators: Davide Corsi, Stefano Mattia, Federico Musetti, Roberto Pitturru
Publisher: Elznir Games
Vendor: JoeKas World GmbH
Release date:10/2024
Playing Age:10 and up
Number of players:2 - 5
Retail price:44.95 €
Playing time:90 minutes
Theme or setting:Fantasy, Mittelalter

König Tritus hat euch, seine vertrauenswürdigsten Statthalter, mit der Aufgabe betraut, die Grenzprovinzen vor dem feindlichen Ansturm zu bewahren und zu verteidigen. Um erfolgreich zu sein, müsst ihr eure rivalisierenden Statthalter ausmanövrieren und die Berater des Königs davon überzeugen, euch zu unterstützen. Nur ein Statthalter wird in den Königlichen Rat aufgenommen, also sammelt eure Ressourcen, baut eure Gebäude und bereitet eure Verteidigung vor. Die Zukunft Kingsburgs liegt in euren Händen!

Eine Partie Kingsburg 3. Edition erstreckt sich über fünf Spielrunden, die als Jahre bezeichnet werden. In jedem Jahr gibt es drei Ertragsphasen, die Jahreszeiten, in denen Rohstoffe gesammelt, Gebäude gebaut und Truppen ausgebildet werden. Jede vierte Jahreszeit ist der Winter, in dem alle Spieler gegen eine Invasionsarmee kämpfen müssen. Jeder Spieler muss sich den Invasoren stellen.

Die Ressourcen für den Bau von Gebäuden und die Ausbildung von Truppen werden durch die Beeinflussung der Berater im Rat des Königs gesammelt. Die Spieler platzieren ihre Würfel auf die Felder der Mitglieder des Rates und jeder Berater gewährt dem Spieler, der diesen Berater in der aktuellen Runde beeinflussen konnte, verschiedene Ressourcen oder weist ihm Soldaten, Siegpunkte und andere Vorteile zu. Der Spieler mit der niedrigsten Summe auf seinen Würfeln wählt als Erster aus, wofür er seine Würfel ausgibt, was dem Ausgleich schlechter Würfelergebnisse dient. Selbst bei einem sehr unglücklichen Wurf kann ein Spieler mit einer guten Anzahl von Ressourcen und/oder Soldaten aus dem Rat hervorgehen.

Am Ende der fünf Jahre gewinnt der Spieler, der seine Provinz am besten entwickelt und den König am meisten erfreut hat.

Kingsburg 3. Edition enthält eine aktualisierte Spielregel und die besten Erweiterungsmodule, die seit der 1.Edition von Kingsburg entwickelt wurden, wie die Soldatenmarker, Statthalterkarten und zusätzliche Gebäude. Außerdem wurden das Artwork und das Design zusammen mit den Spielmaterialien vollkommen überarbeitet.

Kingsburg war das Spiel, das den Dice-Placement-Mechanismus erschaffen hat. Kingsburg 3. Edition darf daher in keiner Spielesammlung fehlen!

In diesem Spiel sammelt ihr Karten mit Porzellan darauf, lasst es zerbrechen und repariert es mit Gold, damit es mehr Punkte bringt. Doch Vorsicht: Alles, was am Spielende noch zerbrochen ist, bringt gar keine Punkte!

Through simple drafting mechanics and strategic choices, players gather cards, break them, and repair them for bonus points. Featuring beautiful artwork and engaging gameplay, Kintsugi is perfect for family and friends. Experience the beauty in imperfection and aim for victory by crafting the most exquisite collection of repaired pottery.

Theme or setting:Kiribati - an islands in the pacific

The beautiful island Kiribati, like many islands in the Pacific, is threatened by climate change. In the foreseeable future, Kiribati will be swept away and sunk by rising sea levels. People can be evacuated by ships and boats - but what about the animals? Fortunately, numerous turtles swim from west to east between Kiribati and the rescue mainland, and the animals of Kiribati can save themselves by jumping from turtle to turtle. But beware! Turtles have their ideas. They may well swim deeper. Or submerge completely. That makes the space on their shells smaller and smaller until it disappears completely. In this game, players rescue various animals from the island. The goal is to get all your animals to the mainland.

The game can be played in three different levels of difficulty and is therefore suitable for children, families and also for multi-players.

The fastest person to solve the task and shout “Meow” wins the cat pile race! Increase the fun with fun team rules!

Overview: Flip over a card and compete against other players to grab the right kitties and stack them to match the arrangement on the card. Be the first player to stack the cats correctly and shout “Meow!” to prove you’re the best kitty cuddler.

Take Kittin everywhere with you! A game in the popular metal box that fits in every pocket.

Klimaxo ist ein unterhaltsames und wissenschaftlich fundiertes Kartenspiel zum Thema Klimawandel, bei dem 2-6 Spieler*innen ab 10 Jahren mitspielen können. Gemeinschaft und Wettbewerb stehen gleichermaßen im Vordergrund.

Ob Retter*in oder Vernichter*in der Erde: Je nach Rolle wirst du im Spiel mit dem Impact alltäglicher Handlungen und gesellschaftlicher Entwicklungen das Klima der Erde abkühlen oder erhitzen. Strategie, Wissen, Schnelligkeit und Glück sind gefragt. Ganz nebenbei können wissenschaftlich fundierte Zusammenhänge mit einfachen Faustformeln zu mehr Klima-Durchblick verhelfen. Ein angeregter Austausch ist garantiert.

Spielerisch zu mehr Klimakompetenz - das geht mit Klimaxo!

Klink is a game of numbers and push your luck packed with interaction and emotions in a portable box. On your turn, take two cards from the deck, look at one of them, then decide whether to keep the cards or offer them to another player; if you offer them, that player can look at one card of their choice, then keep the cards, or offer them to someone else. If the final player is being offered the card, they must keep them. Whoever ends up with the cards takes the next turn.

Knee Deep in Hexes is like deck building meets all your favorite 90's RTS games combined - but this time it's a board game.

Knee deep in Hexes is a 2-player strategy skirmisher. After the exodus from Earth, you fight on a distant desert planet for scarce resources, build extractors, factories and units - from fast construction vehicles to frightening Paloozas.

The queen is dead! Long live the next heir or heiress or pet who survives this fierce battle of backstabbing, betrayal and dirty tricks.

Place one candidate for the throne between every two players and two more in the center of the table.
Each player chooses one of their cards, the number on it will determine the turn order. In that order, the players use the ability of the card on the table, available, furthest to the left, covering the old card with which they have played and, thus, create the new sequence of abilities for the next round.

At the end of the game the candidates for the throne with more daggers than resistance will be eliminated. The candidate with the lowest value alive will be the worthy successor, and the players who are next to him will be the winners... If any...

Playing time:20 minutes
Theme or setting:Join the colorful Koinobori festival with your own mast

Welcome to the fascinating world of koinobori! Immerse yourself in this experience as you explore the beauty and tradition of colorful Japanese kites. In this game, you'll have the opportunity to design and customize your own koinobori mast and embark on a journey through Japanese culture. Are you ready to elevate your dreams like the koinobori do in the sky?

In the game, each player will have their own personal mast, and in the center of the table will be the festival masts, one more than the number of players in the game. There will also be a row of koinobori cards on the table for players to draw from. During a player's turn, they can choose one of these three options:

Place a koinobori card on the festival masts: Play a koinobori card on one of the masts. At the end of the game and on each mast, only the color of the koinobori with the most presence on that mast will score points.

Place a koinobori card on their personal mast: Play koinobori cards face down on your mast. Each card on your mast will improve your abilities. Be aware that the koinobori you place on your mast will determine your score.

Draw koinobori cards: Take a card from the ends of the row of koinobori on the table. Improving your abilities will allow you to draw two cards or not just from the ends.

The game ends when the festival masts are completed, and at that point, the scoring phase begins. Within each mast, it is determined which color of koinobori is most repeated, and each player will earn a number of points equal to the multiplication of the number of koinobori on their personal mast by the number of koinobori on the festival mast.

The player with the highest score will be the winner

Kosmoktopus wirft seinen überirdischen Blick auf euch! Als Gefolgschaft des Großen Tintigen nutzt ihr die Macht bizarrer Gegenstände und Erfahrungen, um den mystischen galaktischen Kopffüßer besser zu verstehen. Nutzt euer schwer erarbeitetes Wissen, um Tentakel zu sammeln. Beweist eure Bewunderung und beschwört Kosmoktopus aus dem Tintenreich!

Sammelt Ressourcen und mächtige Reliquien, Schriften, Halluzinationen und Konstellationen. Nutzt die Kraft dieser bizarren Objekte, kombiniert sie auf besonders geschickte Weise und sammelt vor allen anderen 8 Tentakel, um zu gewinnen.

Despite the fact that the North American automobile industry developed later than in Europe, the innovations in the mass production of vehicles and the immense internal market made the American automobile industry the largest and most powerful in the world.

In Kraftwagen: Age of Engineering, you will push the development of new engines and bodies with which to launch the best possible range of vehicles on the market, and you will have the opportunity to demonstrate the power of your engines in the first Grand Prix that were held in American territory.

Kraftwagen: Age of Engineering reimplements the original design by Matthias Cramer with improvements and simplifications that lessen the luck factor.

Let the roar of the engines resound, let the design of the new models attract buyers from all corners of the world, and get the prestige necessary to become the most famous car builder.

Erst wird gekrakelt, dann wird orakelt!

Die Botschaften des Orakels sind verworren und rätselhaft, aber mit ein bisschen Fantasie lassen sich die Bilder deuten … oder?

In diesem kooperativen Spiel sind alle Zeichnungen schon da – sie warten nur darauf, dass ihr sie dem Linien-Chaos der Zeichentafel entlockt! Ihr müsst Begriffe zeichnerisch darstellen, dürft dabei aber nur den gestrichelten Linien folgen. Sobald ihr fertig seid mit dem Gekrakel und die Zeit abgelaufen ist, wird orakelt. Investigators, embark on an unprecedented voyage with Kronologic and play in an era of your choosing!

Unravel a series of unexplained affairs at the Paris Opera to reestablish the truth. Collect clues about the movements of the implicated characters by determining where they were at the time of the incident: on your turn, align a suspect's card with a special perforated tile and get two pieces of information about their movements. The first piece is for your eyes only, but the second one must be shared with other players!

So do you think you have what it takes to be the first to solve the mystery?

KEY POINTS:

We are in the year 2086. The Titan Kronos escapes from Tartarus with the sole purpose of exacting revenge on humanity for his imprisonment! The Olympians return to face the great threat and seek powerful alliances among gods and humans. Hades from the realm of Acheron and Kallisto from the realm of the Ursa Major will play a pivotal role in the developments of events. Who are the real enemies and who are the allies? Intrigues, betrayals, and unholy alliances take place as the final confrontation approaches. The outcome of this epic battle will determine the future of humanity, or perhaps the extinction of the generation of the Olympians!!!

In this remastered version of "Kronos Epilogue" you will find new mechanics and an overall improved version of the game. This deluxe edition comes with two expansions that will take your experience to the next level. The "Oracle of the Dead" that allows you to take on the role of Hades, King of the Underworld and become the Tyrant that the other players will fight. In Kyoto no Neko, 2 to 4 players are kittens who explore the modern-day city of Kyoto, Japan through a series of independent, replayable scenarios. In each scenario, players must fulfill a variety of missions, from befriending a school boy to fighting an aggressive stray cat, or stealing the food from other player's dinner bowl. Throughout the game, each player will evolve, developing their skills and gaining the ability to explore new parts of the map by climbing on bushes and rooftops.

Using a system of skills, Kyoto no Neko will see each player interact with some of Kyoto's inhabitants, both animal and human.  Each turn provides the opportunity to uncover something new about the city as players will reveal elements from little insects to specific objects or denizens of Kyoto. While some of these elements are represented by cardboard tiles, others come as standees, ensuring a stunning visual presence.

We have developed this version for 2 and 3 players for those who were exposed to the - certainly frustrating - complexity of playing 2 families at the same time just to be able to play La Famiglia with less than 4 people. We have set ourselves the goal of developing a 1vs1 and 2vs1 variant in which each player only plays 1 family and has the same number of turns. Unfortunately, the single player loses - especially in the purely strategic 1vs1 version - the feeling of team play that is important to us, but the thrill is almost greater - especially in 2vs1. We hope you have as much fun with the two versions as we had developing them.

Theme or setting:Witch

Last Sabbath is a masterless rule-light cooperative (or solo) tabletop journaling RPG that takes you and your Coven in a magical journey from the initiation to the confrontation with an awful threat, through the discovery and control of your consuming powers.

You will be able to face the journey alone or in the company of a Coven of sisters and brothers who have chosen, like you, to share the path of magic, but there will be a price to pay every time you use it: to consume the Memories or your own Life. And there is no going back.

From the rite of Initiation to the confrontation with a terrible Threat, to proceed in History you will have to interpret the Signs of what is about to happen using the tool of your choice: tarot cards, runes, dice or coffee grounds. You have no limits, the choice is free, as is the duration and the very nature of the tale, good or evil, redeeming or catastrophic... Just remember that every participant in the Last Sabbath shares the same ability to change the course of events. The only limit is the imagination... or the Fear.

ORIGINAL GAMEPLAY
It is a cooperative (or solo) RPG in which players are called to write the History of their coven in a shared Diary, from the initiatory sabbath to the confrontation with the Threat. As a journaling game, you will track your Memories, create Spells, and write imaginary description from the perspective of your characters newly embarking on their quest for Power which shape how the protagonists overcomes challenges and meets their denouement after seven scenes. The rules are very simple and the events follow one another in turn, improvising together, in a collaborative story. The handbook will inspire you through questions, tests and prompts for adventures, but to move forward in the various scenes, on several occasions you will be asked to interpret the signs extracted from a divination tool such as the Tarot.

DEEP EXPERIENCE
Power comes at a cost: will you spend your Life or Memories for powerful spells, or nurture the connections with your Coven?
And Remember... Each voice is decisive for the narrative and a hasty decision can lead you to ruin!

This RPG won the title of Best Adaptation and the Special Mention thanks to the public vote at the NDU Awards 2023, a contest organized by the international website No Dice Unrolled.

Illustrator: Pedro A. Alberto
Publisher: Broadway Toys LTD

Theme or setting:Pirate

Is it possible to escape by boat when a shipwreck occurs? The difference between sinking, swimming, and safely making it to an island may be just a vote away!

Gameplay in Lifeboats: Plank of Carneades is all about voting, which takes the form of both co-operation and betrayal over the course of play as circumstances change and you find your sailors on the brink of death. During a vote, each player chooses a card from their hand, then everyone reveals their choices at the same time. You have one card of each boat color — which also correspond to the player colors — as well as three captain cards. If you're the only person to play a captain card during a vote, you get to decide the result...but if more than one captain card is played, they're ignored. In either case, each captain card can be played only once.

To set up, take turns placing your officers and sailors in empty spaces on several lifeboats, each of which is heading toward a particular island. The game then proceeds in multiple rounds, with the lead player position rotating each round. Whenever a vote is tied, the lead player breaks the tie.

First, players vote on which ship springs a leak. Whichever color boat receives the most votes has an empty space filled with a water token — and if the boat has no empty spaces, the players on this boat vote to determine which occupant will be thrown overboard to the sharks to keep the boat from sinking. In this type of vote, officers are worth two votes, sailors only one. However, if a ship has more leaks than occupants, it sinks and everyone on board turns into shark chum.

Second, players vote on which ship moves forward one space toward its island. If the ship reaches the island, all of its occupants are safe and will score their player points based on which island was reached.

Third, players scramble to find better chances for survival. Starting with the lead player, each player removes one of their officers or sailors from their respective boat, placing its token behind the boat. Only one occupant can jump from each ship, so a player late in the round might not have to put someone in the water. Then in reverse order, players move their token to an empty space on a different ship...and if the swimmer can't do this because all seat are full, glub glub glub.

Keep playing until all officers and sailors are either safe or dead, then determine who saved the most valuable crew.

Lifeboats: Plank of Carneades differs from Lifeboats in that it allows for up to seven players to fight for seats on ships. In addition, in some circumstances the ships will move faster and more ships will spring a leak, making gameplay move faster. Finally, the captain card is more powerful as players can use it to keep any ship from springing a leak in a round.

Authors: Daniel Danzer, Julian Danzer
Illustrator: Bryn Jones
Publisher: ThunderGryph Games
Release date:10/2024
Playing Age:14 and up
Number of players:2
Retail price:12 €
Playing time:15 minutes
Theme or setting:Light & Darkness

In Light Seeker, both players must increase the amount of light in the world on their turn — but can you bring the light together to win?

To set up, place the nine cubes in a 3x3 grid with space between the cubes and with dark sides on top, then put the blocking token onto the central cube. Each cube has two sides that are all dark, two sides that are half-light (diagonally separated into a dark and a light triangle, marked with a white dot), and two sides being fully light (with a white dot on each triangle). Each light triangle counts as 1 light, so a fully light side counts as 2 light. The starting player tilts one cube into an open space and places Buh, the blocking token, onto any other cube, then the second player starts with the first normal turn.

On a turn, you take two actions. An action can be to (1) slide a cube into an orthogonally adjacent open space, not changing its orientation, or (2) tilt a cube into an orthogonally adjacent open space. You cannot take an action where Buh is located, and after taking your actions, you must move Buh onto any other cube. At the end of your turn, all cubes must be orthogonally or diagonally adjacent to at least one other cube and the total amount of light on the top faces of the cubes must have increased.

A "light area" is created by one or more cubes that have orthogonally (edge to edge) adjacent half or full Bright faces. Multiple light areas can exist on top of the cubes, and they will shift and change over time. If at the end of your turn, you have created a light area that contains at least 7 light, you win.

Who knew that dusty old pile of weird beakers, boilers, and bottles full of strange-smelling ingredients you found in the basement would soon become your ticket to alchemy school? After a bit of tinkering, and perhaps a few mishaps, you and your pals seem to have a knack for it!

Fun is brewing for all ages in Little Alchemists, a game of potion craft and deduction for two-to-four players. Based on the original Alchemists game released in 2014, Little Alchemists is a streamlined standalone version that’s geared toward younger players and their families.

BASIC CONCEPTS:

  • Gather ingredients, and brew and sell potions, all based on experimentation and ingredient deduction

  • Scan ingredients to craft unique potion combinations with a tablet or smartphone

  • Unlock new chapters across multiple replays — each layers on new mechanics and complexity to expand the core experience.

  • A great primer on the basic concepts of Alchemists — once you’ve mastered Little Alchemists, you should be better equipped to try out the original euro game!

Lone Wolves is a two-player dueling game with trick-taking and area majority elements.
As leaders of their respective wolfpacks, players attempt to ensure victory by asserting their dominance and becoming the Alpha of these lands.
To achieve this, they dispatch wolves, of which there are 5 species representing suits, to compete over territories.
The winner of the trick turns the wolf of the opposing player into a lone wolf, thus strengthening their position in that region; whereas the loser of the trick gains a scar, experience which helps their pack grow stronger.

Normalerweise dauerte das Ritual nur Sekunden, bis die Kristallkraft eintrat. Doch nicht heute … Endlose Minuten vergingen, bis er die gewünschte Kraft erhielt, um den Stab für die vor ihm liegende, abenteuerliche Reise aufzuladen.

Hummeln im Hintern haben, das Handtuch werfen, sich aufs Ohr hauen ... unsere Sprache steckt voller absonderlicher Phrasen. Und nicht nur unsere Sprache! In Lost in Translation versucht ihr gemeinsam, die Bedeutung ungewöhnlicher Redewendungen aus 35 Sprachen zu durchschauen. Behaltet ihr den Durchblick oder versteht ihr nur Bahnhof?

Ziel ist es, nach zehn Runden möglichst viele Redewendungen korrekt identifiziert zu haben.

2–8 Personen | Ab 12 Jahren | 10–15 Minuten

Theme or setting:Ecological

An iconic symbol of wilderness, the Canada lynx is an important part of Canadian ecology and history. Lynx are top predators and predominantly hunt snowshoe hare. Because of this, the abundance of snowshoe hare directly affects the abundance of lynx and vice versa. This relationship has become the classic example of predator-prey cycling.

In LYNX, each player takes the role of a late 18th-century fur trapper in the Hudson’s Bay region of northern Ontario exploiting the lynx-hare cycle and outwitting other trappers. Each player starts indebted to the Hudson’s Bay Company which has supplied them with traps in agreement that all pelts be sold exclusively to them.

In order to succeed, you need to time not just market demand, but also the balance of the lynx and hare population. By trapping when the lynx are plentiful and selling pelts at high prices, the trapper who earns the most money pays off their debt and becomes a free trapper.

WILL YOU BE A COMPANY MAN OR A FREE TRAPPER?

Thousands of years ago, a new era was beginning for humankind. The nomadic hunter-gatherers who had laboriously earned their place on Earth organized into small groups, differentiating social roles, building the first settlements, and initiating a great revolution. Scientists call this period "Mesolithic", and this game talks about those people.

In MESOS, you are the leader of an ancient tribe, and as such, your role is to nurture the growth of your tribe by adding new members, ensuring its sustenance, constructing buildings, and addressing unfolding events. Each round, you must place your totem pawn on the offer track, then following the pawns' order on the track, you will acquire character or building cards and add them to your tribe. Each card has specific effects and may earn prestige points (PP) as you construct specialized buildings and prepare wisely for the events you will face.

Whoever manages to bring the most prestige to their tribe wins.

In the board game My Life Be Like, each player represents a zodiac sign. Faced with various life goals that appear each round, the players must decide how much energy they want to use to pursue these goals. They can choose to save energy for future rounds, go all-in and strive for their goals, or even overextend themselves. Every round, the more proactive the player is, the better the chance they can obtain their desired goal before anyone else. However, it also means that they accumulate negative energy at a faster rate. Throughout the long journey of life, the challenge lies in finding a balance between consuming energy to achieve your goals or retaining energy for the long term so as not to be consumed by negative energy.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdqDCjGCacS34qB2XxbOdbkjvuoU96lYlVPxsd0m5C5gWG5ow/viewform

Magic Number Eleven is an innovative sports game depicting the tactical confrontation of football games with simple rules.
It's a 2 player game, and each player becomes a coach of a football team, confronting each other. The game consists of two Rounds; 1st half and 2nd half. Each round consists of several turns.

In your turn, you basically place a Player Card on the Field Board. The meaning of Player Card placement is an expression of where the team is currently focused on and which player is the center of the tactics.
Each Player Card has semicircular tactical icons which can be combined with the icons on other Player Cards. Therefore, each team will have more tactical icons according to the combination of the Player Cards, as the turns go on.

There are 4 different type of tactical icons- Attack, Defence, Pass, and Press- and the action and the effect you may take in your turn vary according to the type and amount of the icons you have been made.
Based on the tactical icons you have, you may 1) attempt a shot, 2) draw Synergy Cards, and 3) push the Control Maker on the Control Track.

When you attempt a shot, compare your attack power and the opponent's defence power. Both of attack/defence power can be strengthened with the Synergy Cards that each player has. The Synergy Cards represent the teamwork and the passing play of the team. And if your Control is high enough, you may add more Synergy Cards to the attack power. If the total of the attack power is higher than the defence power, as a result, it's a goal!

In case you made the total attack power exactly 11, it called a Magic Number, or Wonder Goal, so the opponent can't defend the shot even with the higher defence power. On the other hand, if it exceeds 11, it's always no goal bacause the shot was too strong to be on target. Since there is always at least ONE unknown Synergy Card which has to be played from deck, so you can't guarantee the outcome of the shot!

A round ends when all the Synergy Cards run out. When the 2nd round ends, a team with higher score wins!

On a turn, a player rolls 1-3 six-sided dice to determine whether she moves and if so how far she moves. She rolls the dice one by one, stopping when she wishes, and the sum of the dice rolled can't exceed 7. If she rolls only one die, she moves forward by the number rolled; if she rolled two dice, she moves twice the sum of her dice and if she rolled three dice, she moves three times the sum.

Theme or setting:Victorian Era

The rise of industrialization during the Victorian Era enabled both the mass production of a type of glazed pottery known as majolica as well as its spread to the Far East, including Japan, China, Taiwan, and Southeast Asia. The name “Majolica” comes from the Spanish name for the island of Maio (Cape Verde), which became renowned for (and later synonymous with) its export of high quality colorful glazed pottery tiles.

In the game of Majolica, players take turns to collect majolica tiles from the outlying sides of a 4 x 4 grid and place them in one of their four workshops. When the ratio of the tile colors matches the requirement of the workshop, you may deliver the tiles to your design card and "carry-over" the remaining tiles to the next workshop.

Choose the tiles wisely, arrange your design cards in the right place, and "recycle" your remaining tiles efficiently are the keys to score the most points and win the game.

Majolica: Revised Edition is the new edition of Majolica@2018. Its mechanism was improved and all new art is inside it now!

Jetzt mischen sich die Superhelden in den Kampf ein! Willkommen bei Dice Throne! Herzrasen garantiert! Dice Throne ist schnell gespielt und fordert geschickten Karteneinsatz und clevere Würfelmanipulation. Euer Spieleabend wird eskalieren!

Tritt den Avengers bei! In Marvel Dice Throne schlüpfst du in die Rolle eines berühmten Marvel-Helden! Jeder Held von Marvel Dice Throne wurde sorgfältig entworfen und ausbalanciert, um das bestmögliche thematische Erlebnis zu bieten, so dass du deine Lieblingshelden wirklich verkörpern kannst wie in keinem anderen Spiel. Mit brandneuen Fähigkeiten und asymmetrischen Designs sind dies die bisher innovativsten und aufregendsten Charaktere!

Greife deine Gegner an und aktiviere Fähigkeiten, indem du mit den fünf einzigartigen Würfeln deines Helden würfelst. Sammle Kampfpunkte und gib sie für Karten aus, die eine Vielzahl von Effekten haben, wie z.B. permanente Heldenaufwertungen, Statuseffekte und die direkte Manipulation von Würfeln (deine eigenen, die deines Teamkollegen oder sogar die deines Gegners). In dieser Box sind die folgenden Helden enthalten:

Miles Morales mag klein sein, aber er kann eine fiese Kombo aus Angriffen starten. Praktischerweise kann er sich unsichtbar machen, um seine Verteidigungsfähigkeiten zu verbessern oder Gegner mit zusätzlichem Schaden zu überraschen. Es ist für ihn ein Leichtes, Gerechtigkeit zu üben, indem er seine Spider-Reflexe bis zum Äußersten treibt, und seine Feinde mit seinen Netz-Shootern einfängt.

Scarlet Witch ist eine Meisterin der Wahrscheinlichkeits-Manipulation. Diese Hexe ist in der Lage, die Realität ihrer Gegner zu Albträumen zu verzerren. Während sie Zaubersprüche aus dem Nichts heraufbeschwört, knistern ihre Kräfte voller Macht ihrer Chaos-Magie.

Thors Angriffe sprühen vor Energie, die den Donnergott zu neuen Höchstleistungen anspornen und jede Art von Verteidigung durchbrechen. Wenn er den Griff seines legendären Hammers Mjölnir ergreift, ruft er die Blitze aus dem Sturm herbei, um alle seine Feinde zu vernichten.

Loki, der Gott des Schabernacks, liebt es, sich hinter seinen Illusionen zu verstecken. Mit geschickter Hand verwirrt er seine Feinde und bannt deine Fähigkeiten. Vorsicht ist geboten, wenn er dir lächelnd ein Geschenk macht. Es kann gut sein, dass er dich mit seinen Tricks wieder in die Tasche steckt. Marvel Dice Throne ist eigenständig spielbar & kombinierbar mit anderen Artikeln des Dice Throne Universums. Diese Schachtel beinhaltet ein vollständiges deutschsprachiges Spiel. "
S_ORDER: MARVEL DICE THRONE: BOX 1 (SCARLET WITCH, THOR, LOKI, SPIDER-MAN)
TITEL: Marvel Dice Throne: Box 1 (Scarlet Witch, Thor, Loki, Spider-Man)

INFO:
Authors: Gavan Brown, Nate Chatellier, Manny Trembley
Illustrators: Damien Mammoliti, Manny Trembley

Release date:06/2024

Theme or setting:Marvel

Jetzt mischen sich die Superhelden in den Kampf ein! Willkommen bei Dice Throne! Herzrasen garantiert! Dice Throne ist schnell gespielt und fordert geschickten Karteneinsatz und clevere Würfelmanipulation. Euer Spieleabend wird eskalieren!

Tritt den Avengers bei! In Marvel Dice Throne schlüpfst du in die Rolle eines berühmten Marvel-Helden! Jeder Held von Marvel Dice Throne wurde sorgfältig entworfen und ausbalanciert, um das bestmögliche thematische Erlebnis zu bieten, so dass du deine Lieblingshelden wirklich verkörpern kannst wie in keinem anderen Spiel.

Mit brandneuen Fähigkeiten und asymmetrischen Designs sind dies die bisher innovativsten und aufregendsten Charaktere! Greife deine Gegner an und aktiviere Fähigkeiten, indem du mit den fünf einzigartigen Würfeln deines Helden würfelst. Sammle Kampfpunkte und gib sie für Karten aus, die eine Vielzahl von Effekten haben, wie z.B. permanente Heldenaufwertungen, Statuseffekte und die direkte Manipulation von Würfeln (deine eigenen, die deines Teamkollegen oder sogar die deines Gegners). In dieser Box sind die folgenden Helden enthalten:

Captain Marvel: So explosiv wie Supernovas im Weltraum, ist Captain Marvels Strahlung für alle spürbar. Indem sie die Macht des Kosmos herbeiruft, gleicht ihr Binary-Schlag das Schlachtfeld aus. Hüte dich vor ihrem kosmischen Leuchtfeuer! Alle, die sich ihr entgegenstellen, werden Schaden erleiden.

Black Widow: Im Verborgenen nutzt Black Widow ihr Training für verdeckte Operationen im Roten Raum, um ihren Plan zu schmieden, der mit jeder Verbesserung gefährlicher wird. Und während sie deinen Untergang plant, musst du dich vor ihren tickenden Zeitbomben in Acht nehmen.

Doctor Strange: Die Zusammenstellung seines Spruchbuches ist für den Sorcerer Supreme von entscheidender Bedeutung und so verleiht ihm die Vorahnung eine von anderen Kämpfern ungesehene Kontrolle. Und wenn es nötig ist, kann Doctor Strange sich selbst Hilfe holen, indem er die Zeit zurückdreht, um einen sichereren Weg zum Sieg zu finden.

Black Panther schlägt schnell zu und absorbiert Schaden – er kämpft mit Ehre! Feinde werden es sich zweimal überlegen, bevor sie ihn mit wenig Schaden angreifen, denn er wird mit jedem Schlag stärker. Und wenn du denkst, dass du endlich einen Treffer gelandet hast, minimiert sein Vibranium-Anzug deinen Angriff. Marvel Dice Throne ist eigenständig spielbar & kombinierbar mit anderen Artikeln des Dice Throne Universums. Diese Schachtel beinhaltet ein vollständiges deutschsprachiges Spiel. "

Media Aetas stammt vom Autor Marc André, bekannt für Splendor oder Majesty. Spiele über 16 Runden und gewinne mit den meisten Punkten. Profitiere von Ketten, achte aber auf mögliche Angriffe. Verteidigung ist genau so wichtig wie das richtige Timing beim Angriff.

Media Aetas ist ein interaktives Legespiel. Wer die Liegenschaft mit dem niedrigsten Wert nimmt, darf für die nächste Runde zuerst wählen. Plättchen können auch reserviert werden. Diese Kniffe erlauben ein strategisches Denken. Zudem zeigen Ereigniskarten, was nach jeweils 4 Runden besonders belohnt wird. Dadurch wird jede Spielrunde einzigartig.

Potes vincere Media Aetas ?

Mega Empires — The East is a board game for 3 to 9 players capturing the development of ancient civilizations, from the Middle East to India, over 8000 years of history. Lead your civilization, expand your dominions, cultivate culture and technology, engage in conflicts and trade, apply diplomacy, and face calamities.

The primary objective of the game is to accumulate the most victory points by trading commodities and strategically developing advances, symbolizing each civilization’s wealth and glory. A full game guarantees hours of enjoyment to players who love epic board games with a strong historical context. The extensive diversity in advancements you can develop, and the different scenarios, make sure no two games are the same, even when playing the same civilization!

Mega Empires — The East is a standalone game in the Mega Empires series. You can combine it with Mega Empires — The West to play large games (up to 18 players) or smaller variant scenarios with just 3 or 4 players.

Theme or setting:Ancient Egypt

Founded around 3100 BC and situated south of the Nile Delta, the city of Men-nefer (Memphis in Greek) was the capital of ancient Egypt for nine dynasties and the most populous city on the planet.

 In 1979, it was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site, primarily for its necropolises and pyramid complexes known worldwide, such as Abusir, Saqqara, Dahshur, and Giza.

 In Men-Nefer you will relive one of the greatest periods of ancient Egypt, carrying out tasks typical to Egyptian culture: acquiring knowledge in the Houses of Life, navigating and trading on the Nile River, making offerings at the Great Temple of Ptah, embalming the corpses of the nobles to send them off to a better afterlife, erecting beautiful sphinxes and contributing to the construction of the Great Pyramids. In addition to this, you must be careful of how you make your way through this earthly world to be sure that Osiris will grant you passage to Aaru, the long-awaited heavenly paradise of the afterlife.

Theme or setting:Fantasy

Kontrolliert das Chaos, indem ih neue Zauber erschafft, unbekannte Magie entdeckt und heroische Taten vollbringt! Übernehmt die Rollen von weißen Magiern und nutzt die Elemente, um mächtige, nie gesehene Zauber zu erschaffen. Beeinflusse dein Glück durch Können mit thematischen Spielmechaniken Kontrolliere die chaotische Natur der Elemente und nutze sie als Bausteine neuer Zauber. Die Elemente nehmen die Form von Würfeln an, die ihre wankelmütige Natur widerspiegeln. Ihr müsst ständig die Optionen abwägen, mit denen ihr die Elementwürfel manipulieren könnt. Passt euer Vorgehen den stetigen Veränderungen an. Glück spielt eine Rolle, aber viel wichtiger ist, wie ihr die Ergebnisse nutzt! Mit dem einzigartigen Equilibrium und den asymmetrischen Klassen und Artefakten müsst ihr viele Faktoren bedenken. Die taktische Tiefe von Mercurial ist vielfältig und äußerst befriedigend. Einige Zauber vermischen sich leicht mit anderen, während andere besonders umsichtigen Umgang benötigen. Manche stehen in direktem Konflikt zueinander und verpuffen bei Kombinationen miteinander. Findet die richtige Balance und löst vielleicht sogar einen einzigartigen Effekt namens Equilibrium aus - eine noch größere Spruchkombination als die Summe ihrer Teile!

Author: Shun & AYA (Studio GG)
Illustrator: Sai Beppu
Publisher: JELLY JELLY GAMES
Release date:10/2024
Playing Age:10 and up
Number of players:1 - 4
Retail price:47.99 €
Playing time:30 minutes
Theme or setting:American Wild West, Town Construction

Minecart Town is a tile laying, resource management game for 1-4 players designed by Studio GG and published by JELLY JELLY GAMES. It is a remake of Studio GG’s self-published 2023 title “My Trolley Town”.

In the game, players compete to earn the highest amount of victory points over 4 rounds, each consisting of 4 sequential phases:

1 Production

Players place resources on resource producing buildings within their town. Resources cannot exceed a buildings resource capacity. This phase is simultaneous.

2 Construction

Players take turns constructing additional tiles into their town. There are building tiles and railroad track tiles. All tiles must be placed orthogonally adjacent to existing tiles. All tiles carry a resource cost which must be paid in full in order to construct a tile. Once a player passes, they are not able to construct again during this round.

3 Transportation

In this simultaneous phase, players can transport resources between building tiles by utilizing railroad tracks. Only buildings connected via railroad tracks can receive resources. Additionally, the type and resource limit must be observed.

4 Processing

In this final and simultaneous phase, building tiles with processing effects can process resources into victory points or other resources.

During the fourth round of the game, players can interchangeably perform the transportation and processing phases.

Players must balance their resource spend, their building & railroad track construction, and strategically activate building effects in order to score the highest amount of victory points and win the game!

Im alten Reich Kreta, inmitten der sonnigen Küsten und labyrinthischen Gänge von Knossos, ist das Schicksal der minoischen Kultur noch nicht entschieden. Als Mitglied eines der vier glorreichen minoischen Stämme ist es deine Bestimmung, um den angesehenen Titel des Minos, des Oberhaupts aller Stämme, zu buhlen.


Aber bedenke – im Gegensatz zu den brutalen Eroberungszügen anderer Völker sind die Minoer für ihre Bemühungen um Frieden und Wohlstand bekannt. Auf dieser fesselnden Reise liegt das Ziel deiner Mission nicht im Kampf mit dem Schwert, sondern in der Kunst des Verwaltens und Kultivierens der Einzigartigkeit deines Stammes.

Der Titel des Minos erwartet dich. Beweise, dass du dich am besten als Oberhaupt für diese mysteriöse Zivilisation eignest. Plane deine Aktionen mit Bedacht, klettere die Fortschrittsleisten hoch, verbessere deine Aktionen, kämpfe gegen die rätselhaften Seevölker, errichte Handelsrouten und baue Städte, welche Zeitalter überdauern. Bist du für die Herausforderung bereit?

Eine Roll & Write Rettungsmission gegen die Zeit.

1972 hat die S.A.G.A (The Space and Aeronautics Global Alliance) erstmalig die Hyperraumreise zum Mars erfolgreich absolviert. Doch die Feier war von kurzer Dauer, denn die Crew der Rakete Mercury III hat ihr Wiedereintrittsfenster verpasst und eine Explosion beschädigte die Rakete. Jetzt müsst ihr zusammenarbeiten, um die Rakete und ihre Crew sicher nach Hause zu bringen.

Mission Control: Critical Orbit ist ein asymmetrisches, kooperatives Roll & Write Rettungsabenteuer in Echtzeit. Ein Spieler schlüpft in die Rolle des Aethernaut Flight Commander und bis zu 3 andere Spieler übernehmen die Rollen von Flight Controllers der Mission Control. Diese müssen für den Aethernauten Werkzeug bereitstellen, damit er die Sauerstoffversorgung der Rakete reparieren kann, bevor eure Zeit (20 Minuten) abläuft.

Monster Smash is a fast-paced family-friendly(ish) card game. Easy to learn, quick to play, fun for hours!

Choose your monster, then prepare to
ATTACK your opponents to steal their cards
DEFEND against players who target you
COLLECT enough cards to declare victory
SURVIVE and be the last player standing!

The game is played using cards and can be won in 2 different ways: by collecting cards (6 of your own suit, or 15 cards total) or by being the last player standing!

Each turn starts by drawing cards. You may then 'burn' cards - this allows you to discard cards from your hand and draw half the number from the deck, meaning you can swap some of the cards you don't need for a chance of getting the ones you want! You can then attack - using your own suit (and up to 1 card of another suit) to target another player and try to reduce their cards.

When a player runs out of cards, they are out!

But nobody stays out for long. Monster Smash is fast, fun, and great for all ages.

1st of July in Quebec, Canada: On this same day every year, more than 100,000 people want to move house. Why?

In years past, all rental agreements ended on this day and, by law, could only be extended on this date. Although this rule has since changed, many people still follow this old ‘moving day’ tradition. However, because it’s almost impossible to book a moving company for this date, you have to ask friends and family for help. This doesn’t always go smoothly of course: Some people aren’t strong enough, others are too clumsy, and sometimes too many people show up.

The goal is to score the most points by skilfully filling your vehicles with boxes, keeping track of their weight, and not damaging any fragile boxes, all while assigning your helpers to the right vehicles.

Join the exciting school fair and take part in the grand mission, with students acting as little merchants selling premium stationary, from pricing, store layout, to marketing! Who will take the no.1 winning spot at the school fair? Time to give it all you’ve got at My Little First Sale!

Before starting the game every player receives their own player board which is their shop, player screen and item cards. Open the customer cards and place them in a row on the table. They are students who come to buy things in each player's shop.

Every player places an item card on their player board. He can set the selling price and the attractiveness of the items sold by placing ranking cards. The Player screen will help keep the placement of cards secret.

When everyone is ready we will remove the player screen and start selling. The customers lined up on the table go one by one to buy the items they want. The customer will see which store sells the item he or she wants at the cheapest price. If there are two shops with the same price, The customer will look at the attractiveness of the item.

The game is played over 4 rounds and the player who earns the most money from sales wins the game.

- Two game ideas help develop a basic understanding of rules

- Promotes care of animals and developing empathy through play

My-town is a 2-4 player town building area control game.
The rules in this family friendly game are easy to learn, and are suitable for families and experienced gamers.
Players roll dice and move around the board to purchase stores and facilities,
develop the residential areas, and attract more people to increase the liveliness of the town,
to restore it to glory.

The Town is divided into 4 areas, try to gain control of the areas by placing more people, houses and upgrades.
Once you have successfully developed a house in each of the 4 areas, build your landmark in one of the areas!
Declare that area as "My Town", and race around the board.
As soon as you reach "My Town", the area with your landmark you win!

Create your own galaxy and let your stars shine their brightest.
A galactic puzzler.
🤫 Psst: Nebula glows in the dark.

In Nebula, you must collect stars to place them in your galaxy. From Red Giants to White Dwarfs, stars are obtained through a clever selection mechanism that thematically manipulates time. Then, you must place them into specific orbits and constellations while observing the laws of gravity. Additionally, there are personal and collective goals that can reward you, and black holes play a very special role.
Bring your galaxy to life and find harmony in your star formations. Nebula features an Advanced Module where players can influence the scoring of additional objectives themselves. This keeps Nebula engaging for both casual and avid players alike.

Author: Dani García
Illustrator: Jennifer Giner
Publisher: Combo Games
Vendor: Combo Games
Release date:10/2024
Playing Age:14 and up
Number of players:1 - 4
Retail price:25 €

Theme or setting:Fantastic Japan. City ruled by yakuza cats

The sushi production and distribution in the city of Mininogata is controlled by several feline clans. Leading those clans is the Kumichō, supreme leader of the syndicate, but he is now an old cat and soon will have to decide who will succeed him.

In Neko Syndicate you will lead one of those clans and you will prove the Kumichō who deserves to inherit his position, building an efficient chain of command and fulfilling the great amount of sushi demanded by the population. In addition, you will be rewarded if you are the fastest to achieve the missions by the Kumichō.

During the game you will build and walk down a card’s pyramidal structure which represents both a city district under your control and your chain of command. This pyramidal structure will be used as a board and action tree which will allow you to cook sushi and transport it into different delivery zones, trying to achieve the missions by the supreme leader. You will have 15 turns to obtain as many prestige points as possible to please the supreme leader Kumichō and, therefore, win the game.

Neko Syndicate is a "Thinky-filler" by Dani García, featuring an innovative tableau building mechanic where cards are both the actions and the goals to achieve: fast set-up, simultaneous play, low interaction and brain burner in a 30 minutes easy to play hard to master beautiful game.

Illustrator: Gilles Warmoes
Publisher: HUCH!
Vendor: Hutter Trade GmbH

Playing Age:15 and up

Retail price:37.99 €

Auf einer kleinen Insel Japans sollt ihr Strommasten aufstellen und die Viertel miteinander verbinden. Das Problem: Es gibt einfach nicht genug Platz, daher müsst ihr die Strommasten immer höher bauen. Noch dazu ist die Insel voller Katzen, die sich an die Leitungen hängen und eigentlich immer im Weg sind. Aber mit kühlem Kopf und ruhiger Hand wirst du erfolgreich sein - mit den Mitspielern oder gegen sie!

Author: Ivan Lashin
Illustrators: Evgeny Zubkov, Nick Gerts
Publisher: Hobby World
Release date:08/2024
Playing Age:10 and up
Number of players:2 - 4
Retail price:32 €
Playing time:45 minutes
Theme or setting:Future

Neodreams is an engine-building eurogame where players manage their own Dream-producing corporations. With the unique twist on worker placement mechanism they will gather resources from the board and their engine to build the best dream entertainment in the galaxy.

In the near future, an astonishing new technology has been developed that allows the sleeping mind and machine to be connected. It is called Oneiroshunt, and with it, the business of crafting and selling dreams has become a thriving industry. For the right price, clients can learn new skills, overcome deep-seated fears, and travel to the most extraordinary locations all from the comfort of their beds.

In Neodreams, each player is the CEO of a company that is developing and using this technology, and they must expand fast to keep up with the competition. In this economic strategy game, players will deploy their Oneironauts to gather resources, craft stunning experiences, improve dreamscapes, and gain clients. The player who accumulates the most wealth once enough dreams have been created will dominate the Oneiroshunt industry for years to come!

Als du mit deinen Wikingern am Ufer anlegst, sind die ertragreichen Landstriche bereits verwaist. Dieses verheißungsvolle Neuland ruft natürlich auch andere Clans auf den Plan, dir den kostbaren Grund streitig machen wollen. Breite dich aus, erobere Gebäude und sammle wichtige Ressourcen. Gold, Vieh, Holz … was davon benötigst du für deine Siedlung? Setze deine Wikinger mit strategischer Weitsicht und taktischer Finesse ein und werde zum größten Jarl deiner Zeit.

Illustrator: Hanna Kuik

The eighteenth additional army for Neuroshima Hex, one of the longest-supported board games on the market!

What? You thought that desert meant one big, empty, silent death zone? For normies, sure, but everything that makes the newcomers cease to exist, simply makes the locals more indestructible. Be careful with them—these people of the desert, wasteland tribes, children of heat and contamination... all those who’ve decided survival is just another extreme sport.

Authors: Till Meyer, Herbert Saurugg, Nicole Zeller
Illustrator: Christian Opperer
Publisher: Spieltrieb
Vendor: Kagu Spiele
Release date:10/2023
Playing Age:12 and up
Number of players:2 - 8
Retail price:75 €
Playing time:180 minutes
Theme or setting:Blackout simulation

There has been a blackout that has lasted for several days.

Everyone in the city will have to try to cope with the situation as best they can, but the municipal crisis teams and emergency organizations will be particularly challenged. It is not clear how long the blackout will last and if, as is currently the case, a large part of the population has nothing to eat after just a few days, it will be very difficult to maintain calm and order. If this does not succeed, chaos and anarchy are imminent. And this is exactly where the Neustart simulation comes in - to make such a situation manageable for as long as possible in an emergency.

As a local crisis team, the players must work together with the population to try and overcome the complex problems and surprises in the best possible way. Many of the problems and their complexity are not yet known when the blackout occurs. Nor how long it will take before the power supply can be restored.

Dealing with uncertainty and insecurity, possibly with failures and losses, will challenge the players enormously and make for an exciting game.

Author: Matthew Dunstan
Illustrator: Maxime Morin
Publisher: HCM Kinzel
Vendor: HCM Kinzel
Release date:08/2024
Playing Age:8 and up
Number of players:1 - 4
Retail price:19 €

NEXT STATION PARIS ist der Nachfolger von NEXT STATION LONDON, das zum "Spiel des Jahres 2023 nominierte" Flip&Write-Spiel. Erlebe in diesem dritten Spiel der Flip&Write-Serie "Next Station" die faszinierende französische Metropole und gestalte das Pariser U-Bahnnetz ganz neu! Tauche ein in ein aufregendes Spielerlebnis, bei dem Du die U-Bahn-Linien völlig neu gestaltest, um am Ende die meisten Punkte zu erzielen.

Nutze deine strategischen Fähigkeiten, um die Brücken geschickt zu überqueren und die Wahrzeichen der Stadt zu erreichen. Entdecke clevere Abkürzungen auf den zentralen Bahnsteigen, um deine Linie zu optimieren. Tauche ein in ein aufregendes Spielerlebnis, bei dem du die Pariser U-Bahn völlig neu gestaltest, um am Ende die meisten Punkte zu erzielen. Wer wird die beste U-Bahn planen?

Alle Spiele der NEXT STATION-Reihe können zu viert und ebenso gut alleine gespielt werden. Als Solitärspiel darf es bei keiner Bahnfahrt fehlen. Ergänzend gibt es in jedem Set weitere Karten für fortgeschrittene Spieler.

Discover the fragments of the night sky, look for the particular stars and draw precise maps of the constellations. But beware!
You do not want the big constellations to overshadow the small ones. Each card in the game represents one of the most famous
constellations. Your task is to mark them on the rotating map, following the special astronomical rules. Will your map be the most precise, granting you the name of the true Night Sky Explorer?

In this game, players take on the role of astronomy enthusiasts who stare at the starry skies for hours. During the game, they will use their boards with rotating maps to mark the star constellations they see - each player marks their unique constellations on their maps. Points are awarded for each constellation marked on the map that contains the correct stars. Additionally, players receive points for placing their constellations in the right places on the map.
The player with the highest total amount of points at the end of the game wins.

Playing Age:7 and up
Number of players:2 - 5
Retail price:12 €
Playing time:15 minutes
Theme or setting:Ninja

In Ninjan, your aim is to recruit the best ninjas for your team. Play your cards at the right time and outsmart your opponents to get their best recruits. When will you be able to play? What will happen before your turn? These are just some of the questions you'll be trying to answer as you prepare your cards. Ninjan is a game where you have to anticipate your opponents' actions to gain an advantage.

1. Choose one of your cards. Be careful, you'll have to play them all by the end!

2. When everyone has chosen, reveal your cards. The one with the highest value goes first.

3. Pick up a pile of cards from the centre of the table using the rock, paper, scissors rule. Your card replaces this pile on the table.

Will your strategy go according to plan? Keep the cards you have won and accumulate as many victory points as possible to win the game.

Nocturne is a beautiful strategy board game for 1-4 players that plays in 30-45 minutes.

From the team that brought you Calico, Cascadia, Verdant, and Fit to Print, this LUCI award-winning game designed by David Iezzi and developed by the Flatout Games CoLab is a delightfully interactive puzzle with a highly competitive spatial bidding mechanism on a shared play area.

Illustrators: Andreas Resch, Zbigniew Umgelter, Aleksander Zawada

Bringt das Nukleum nach Australien!
Als Elsa von Frühlingsfeld dem König von Sachsen vor einer Generation ihren Apparat - das Nukleum - vorstellte, leitete sie eine neue Ära der Energie und des Wohlstands ein. Diese Revolution hatte so einen großen Einfluss auf die Welt, dass bald alle Nuklea einsetzen wollten.

Da der Kontinent Australien sehr große Uranvorkommen hat, wollen Visionäre ihn in eine neue globale Großmacht verwandeln. Seine Größe birgt neue Herausforderungen, welche durch den Einsatz von Seewegen gelöst werden können.

Außerdem hat es ein exzentrischer Wissenschaftler geschafft, Elsa von Frühlingsfelds Experiment auf der Insel Tasmanien nachzuahmen ...

Das Grundspiel ist im fiktiven Sachsen des 19. Jahrhunderts angesiedelt.Aber mit der Erweiterung werdet ihr auf die andere Seite der Welt entführt, nämlich auf den namensgebenden Kontinent - Australien.

Außer dem neuen Transportmittel - den Schiffen - bekommt ihr eine neue Möglichkeit der Stromerzeugung: Kohleminen!

Zum Spielen wird das Grundspiel benötigt

Authors: Simone Luciani, Dávid Turczi
Illustrators: Andreas Resch, Zbigniew Umgelter, Aleksander Zawada
Publisher: B-rex Entertainment
Vendor: B-rex Entertainment
Release date:12/2024
Playing Age:14 and up
Number of players:1 - 4
Retail price:28 €
Playing time:60 minutes

Seid ihr bereit für politische Ränke?

Während das 19. Jahrhundert seinem Ende zugeht kämpfen die Monarchien Europas in diesem sich rasch ändernden Zeitalter um ihren Machterhalt. Egal, ob am Hof von König Friedrich von Sachsen oder an dem der alternden Königin Victoria von England, die versucht, ihre Herrschaft über die Reichtümer Australiens aufrecht zu erhalten. Sie alle müssen sich gegen die aufstrebenden politischen Mächte behaupten, die während der nuklearen Revolution ein Stuck vom Kuchen abhaben wollen. Wahrend in Parlamenten Ideologien aufeinanderprallen, müssen Unternehmende wie ihr sicherstellen, dass sie in den Hallen der Macht ausreichend Freundschaften schließen. Nukleum ist ein Expertenspiel für 1 bis 4 Industrielle ab 14 Jahren mit Management- und Netzwerk-Elementen. Mit der neuen Erweiterung kommt auch ein neues Element hinzu - die politischen Parteien. Neben dem Ausbau eures Stromnetzes müsst ihr euch auch noch die Gunst der Kapitalisten, Freidenker, Kommunisten und Royalisten erkämpfen und sogar ihren Vorsitz übernehmen.

Zum Spielen wird das Grundspiel benötigt

Illustrator: Tonpy

Release date:10/2024

Theme or setting:Develop Nukumi into a fun town renowned for it's food scene!

*EN rule newly added

In Nukumi Onsen Kaitakuki, players develop vacant lots in the onsen town of Nukumi.

Nukumi Onsen Kaitakuki is a bag building game, with many paths to victory. Many characters and helpers from the previous game, Nukumi Onsen Hanjouki, also appear in this game, supporting the player in various ways!

On their turn, players gain helpers, and resources and then complete actions by drawing tokens from their bag. Players can move their pieces around the central game board, and build buildings, developing the profile of the town as a fun place with delicious foods.

Player gain victory points bu building buildings, playing helper cards, earning money, and a number of potential bonuses! At the end of 5 rounds, the player with the most victory points is the winner!

Retail price:13 €
Playing time:20 minutes
Theme or setting:Numbers

Play cards from your hand by connecting their numbers with the card on the floor while following the conditionss: Pivot or Relay. Depending on the current condition, play multiple cards that starts with same number, or connect the numbers on the cards you play. Empty your hand by the end of the round or receive penalty points for each card you couldn't play. After 3 rounds, the player with the lowest sum of penalty points wins.

  • Easy rules that can be taught in less than 5min

  • Simple and intuitive gameplay with twists

  • Craft your own strategies by actively using Wild Cards and Reset

Authors: Eliška Holubová, Marek Vejborný

Publisher: Albi
Release date:10/2024
Playing Age:6 and up
Number of players:2 - 4
Retail price:28 €
Playing time:30 minutes
Theme or setting:3D board game with Squirrels

Nutventure is a children's game for 2 to 4 players of age 6 and up with a game time of around thirty minutes by the debuting author Eliška Holubová and Albi’s very own Marek Vejborný. The players will take control of squirrels trying to hoard nuts for a winter. They will move on and around the 3D-tree using 3 coloured dice and try to plan their movements to avoid the predators – fox and owl – that can scare them and strip them of their loot.

Authors: Valentino Sergi, Andrea Rossi
Illustrators: Jorge Coelho, Marco Sada, Valentina Tretola, Mimir, Fabio Babich, Veronica Wu, Moreno Paissan
Publisher: Officina Meningi
Release date:01/2024
Playing Age:99 and up
Number of players:1 - 7
Retail price:20.00 €
Playing time:180 minutes
Theme or setting:Greek mythology

Odyssey - Black Tales is a rules-light tabletop RPG for 1, 2 or more players compatible with 5e, Old School Essentials and Mörk Borg. You will be part of Ulysses' crew, the greatest liar in history, and rank in his small army of marauders.

Ulysses and his crew sacked and pillaged their way across the Great Sea, stealing treasures and oppressing its peaceful people. His ship bore no flags and the Marauders’ faces were concealed so as to avoid being recognised.

But the lost song of the Sirens tells of a small band of true heroes which acted, unbeknownst to their captain, to foil him and save as many people as possible from his bloodthirst. Their plan was to overthrow the tyrant Ulysses and end his streak of violence, but the legends do not say whether they succeeded.

Now, you are tasked with telling the true tale of the Odyssey. Will you partake in the pillaging of the Mediterranean or will you risk your life in an attempt to protect the peoples of the Great Sea? The choice is yours ...

The game’s handbook will have you face Ulysses’ crew’s darkest moments, from the battle with the Cicones to the mortal straits of Scylla and Charybdis in 7 breathtaking adventures (with 7 tactical maps).

The manual will also include rules for solo and duet games modes and the Basic Old School System developed by Andrea Rossi (curator of Old School Essentials), a quick and simple system applicable to any setting with only three stats used for roll-under tests, with the number of dice rolled determined by the test itself.

Author: Benoit TURPIN & Florien SIRIEIX
Illustrator: Henri KERMAREC
Publisher: BLUE COCKER GAMES
Vendor: BLUECOCKER GAME
Release date:05/2024
Playing Age:7 and up
Number of players:2 - 6
Retail price:16 €
Playing time:15 minutes
Theme or setting:Gem collection

While playing ONIX, you’re looking to create Collections of 4 different Gems. Collect more Gems than your opponents by being strategic and opportunist. Use the effects of the Gems to grab a few more!

KEY STRENGTHS : - Easy to share with everyone.

- Excellent for two players.

- An advanced mode that adds tension andinteraction.

COMPONENTS :

• 80 Single Gem cards

• 24 Double Gems cards

• 6 player aid cards

• 1 rulebook

HOW TO PLAY :On your turn, choose a Gem from the central piles and take a card with that Gem on it, as well as all adjacent and consecutive cards sharing the same Gem. Place these cards in front of you on your collections. Then apply the gem’s effect:

ROUND/DRAW (take a card from a deck),

SQUARE/HOARD (place a card from a deck in your hoard),

LOSANGE/STEAL (take a card from an opponent) or

CROSS/DESTROY (discard an opponent’s card). Finally, place in your hoard all collections which have 4 gems. Whoever has the most cards in their hoard at the end of the game wins!

Author: Luis Álvaro Hernández

ONUS! Traianus is a miniature wargame without actual miniatures about war conflicts in the 1st and 2nd centuries CE. Play as one of 8 historically accurate armies, suppress the enemy’s troops with battle formations and watch them flee when their morale breaks!

Gather troops for your favorite army, choose illustrious generals to lead soldiers into combat and delve into exciting battles of ancient times. Each troop card functions as a segmented unit stand, and a stat sheet at the same time, which allows for quicker tactical data access resulting in swifter decisions. Finally, the order/event cards system will make each of your battles feel fresh and unique. 

Reconstruct great battles of the past and get imbued with the spirit of the ancient era with ONUS! Traianus!

OPEN is a climbing and shedding game in which each person plays with four of their six cards face up on the table.

At the start of each hand, players make a secret bet on which player they think will play all of their cards first. Points are awarded to all players but the last to go out. Points are also awarded to players who accurately predicted who would go out first.

Rounds are played until one player reaches a given score, then the player with the most points wins.

Cosmic divinities, you come together to create an entire planet. Including its ecosystem, minerals and other elements essential to life. Will you be able to collaborate in the silence of space to make this world viable and lush? Gods don't play dice... Prove it!

ORIGINE is a cooperative game of deduction, you can't communicate with your partners. Reflection, estimation of intentions and deduction will enable you to acquire team coordination. An original cooperative game mechanic that requires subtlety.

Author: Chris Williams
Illustrator: Asritha Nancharla

Operation Barclay is a two-player game of low/medium complexity about the intelligence war between the Allies and their Abwehr counterparts in the Mediterranean theater in 1942-1943.

With the Axis powers ejected from North Africa, there was debate as to where the Allies might strike next. At Casablanca (January 14-24, 1943), Roosevelt and Churchill agreed the next target: Operation Husky, the invasion of Sicily, would begin July 9 1943 — but there was a problem. The Axis powers suspected Sicily would be the target, and knew there were deception activities in motion to attempt to mislead them about what they already knew.

On top of this, with Operation Husky already planned for early July, there was little time for Allied intelligence to work with. In these six months, Allied intelligence had to create sufficient disinformation to persuade their intelligence counterparts, the Abwehr, that the primary attack and a suspected secondary attack would be aimed elsewhere within the Mediterranean. This essential intelligence operation was dubbed "Operation Barclay".

Operation Barclay puts players in the shoes of competing military intelligence directors who are attempting to mask or learn the truth about the Allied invasion plans for 1943. The Abwehr must attempt to learn where the Allies intend to land next. The London Controlling Section (LCS), the core intelligence agency responsible for Allied intelligence, must prevent the Abwehr from discovering the truth.

The LCS player uses a variable set-up, placing tiles face down to establish where amongst the five geo-strategic options in the Mediterranean a primary and a secondary offensive will occur. Over the course of the six game months, the Abwehr player attempts to win sufficient evidence tokens to be able to turn enough of these tiles face-up to reveal where the Allied offensives will come. Every evidence token the LCS player wins prevents another tile from being revealed.

To win evidence tokens, players build hands of five cards to take tricks, similar to poker. While having the best hand will secure two evidence tokens, correctly betting after each player reveals the first three cards of each hand on who will have the best five-card hand is worth three evidence tokens. Thus, getting and bluffing and seeding disinformation is more important than being lucky with a card draw. In addition, each player competes for another evidence token by having the most raid or reconnaissance icons on their cards.

Further, players have ways to manipulate the decks from which they draw. They may create a double-cross deck, allowing them to leave cards useful to them face down in a deck to draw from when they choose later — unless the other player takes those cards instead...but perhaps the player who planted those cards was bluffing and hoping the other player would waste their draw on a useless card...

Alternatively, players may draw from their own dedicated deck to augment their hands with unique abilities inspired by historical figures, events, and capabilities. The LCS has access to Ultra — decrypts of German codes — but this alone will not be enough if it's not used carefully.

In Panda Spin, each player attempts to be the first to rid their hand of cards, collecting bamboo in the process to keep their pandas well fed.

In more detail, Panda Spin is a climbing game played with a special deck of "double-headed" cards. All cards start with the orange animals toward the top. Each player receives a random wind card — each of which has a unique playing condition — and a hand of eleven cards, with the remaining cards placed in a deck.

During the game, players lay down cards to tricks as singles, in sets, in runs, or in formations (two consecutive pairs, two consecutive triples, etc.) If you're the first player in a trick, lead what you wish other than a bomb, that is, four or more cards of the same value. In turn, players must play a higher matching set of cards, e.g. a higher three-of-a-kind on a three-of-a-kind, or pass, after which they can no longer play in a trick. (A bomb cannot be lead, but can be played on any card combination.)

When you pass, if you've played cards and all of those cards have orange animals at the top, flip the cards so that the blue animals are at top. Each time you flip a card, you change its value depending on its suit: e.g., the water 4 becomes a pair of Qs, the wood 6 becomes a A+bamboo (and each time you play a card with bamboo, you take a bamboo token from the reserve), the earth 8 becomes a Q+panda (with you stealing a bamboo from an opponent for each panda you play), the fire 3 becomes a 10+fire, with the fire being a value of your choice when played.

If you pass and the cards you've played have at least one blue animal, you discard all of those played cards. The winner of the trick always discards all of their played cards, then they lead to the next trick. When you play a wind card — the south wind, for example, beats a run or formation with 3+ different numbers in it — you draw two cards from the deck; subsequent players need only beat the card combination played prior to your wind. If you play a wind, you always discard all cards you played to the trick.

When a player runs out of cards — that is, they "show out" — they score bamboo equal to how many cards are held by the player with the largest hand. When all but one player have shown out, the round ends, then you shuffle all the cards (including the winds) and deal everyone a new hand. A player immediately wins the game when they have at least twenty bamboo — but they must score their 20th bamboo by showing out; playing wood and panda cards scores you no bamboo when you have nineteen bamboo.

In diesem Spiel kommt es auf gute Kommunikation an. Bildet Teams, bestehend aus Flugbegleitern und Crew-Mitgliedern.
