Theme or setting:Berge

In vergangenen Zeiten brachte das Erwachsenwerden einen in Ehren gehaltenen Initiationsritus mit sich: Jedes Jahr zur Sommersonnenwende trafen sich werdende Erwachsene im richtigen Alter, um einen nahegelegenen und beunruhigend hohen Berg zu erklimmen. Auf ihrem beschwerlichen Aufstieg – so sagt es die Legende – entdeckten sie so manchen Naturgeist und empfingen seine Lehre. Endlich am Gipfel angekommen, entzündeten sie Leuchtfeuer, um so den Beweis ihrer Reife zu erbringen.

Auf auf! Der Berg ruft!

In Solstis liefert ihr euch zu zweit ein bergsteigerisches Duell. Im Spiel von Bruno Cathala und Corentin Lebrat ab 8 Jahren gewinnt, wer die meisten Punkte erzielt. Die bekommt man für die Anzahl an Bergteilen im größten eigenen Gebiet, durch entzündete Leuchtfeuer und durch entdeckte Naturgeister.

Das alles schafft man, indem man Bergteile ausspielt. Wenn du an der Reihe bist, spielst du ein Bergteil von deiner Hand aus und prüfst, ob entweder seine Farbe oder seine Zahl zu einem der Bergteile in der Wildnis (einer Auswahl von Bergteilen zwischen euch) passen. Ist das der Fall, darfst du sowohl das ausgespielte als auch ein passendes Bergteil in deine Auslage legen. Alle Bergteile zeigen eine einmalige Kombination aus einer Farbe und einer Zahl. Durch diese Kombination ist genau festgelegt, wohin in deiner Auslage du das Bergteil legen musst.

Wenn es dagegen kein passendes Bergteil in der Wildnis gibt, bekommst du zunächst eine zweite Chance mit einem zufällig gezogenen Teil. Wenn auch das nicht passt, bekommst du als Entschädigung einen Regenbogen. Dabei handelt es sich um einen Joker, den du beliebig legen darfst. So kannst du vielleicht eine wichtige Lücke zwischen zwei Gebieten füllen, wo dir das entscheidende Verbindungsstück vor der Nase weggeschnappt wurde.

Naturgeister erhältst du immer, wenn du ein 2×2 Felder großes Quadrat in deiner Landschaft abschließt. Diese Naturgeister haben meistens einen tollen Soforteffekt oder geben dir einen Bonus bei der Endwertung.

Zur Endwertung kommt es, wenn der Vorrat mit Berg-Teilen aufgebraucht ist. Dann gilt es nur noch, Punkte zu zählen.

Was gemütlich klingt, kann ganz schön gemein sein. Denn die richtigen Teile wegzuschnappen ist fast so wichtig, wie für sich selbst die besten auszusuchen.

Theme or setting:Scavenger hunt

In Spotlight your goal is to find as many as possible to advance your pawns on the track and cross the finish line, without any player being reached by the Moon pawn that is chasing you.

The game is played over five rounds. Each player has a different board composed of a transparent layer on top, depicting a different part of the game scene, and a black cardboard background, that makes everything dark and difficult to see.

At the beginning of each round, the hidden picture to search is determined by looking at the card on top of the deck. When everybody is ready, players start looking for the hidden picture on their board with their “magic” flashlight, which can illuminate the board thanks to its white spot.

When the sand timer runs out, players must stop searching, put down their flashlights, and set their dial on the number of hidden picture they think they have found. Then, they reveal the back side of the hidden picture card, which shows how many it was actually possible to find. The more you found, the more your pawn advances on the track…but beware, the Moon pawn will advance, too!

If the Moon overtakes any player’s pawn, you can spend a rush token to get them back in front of the Moon, but if you lack rush tokens, the game is over and you all lose! If all players cross the finish line without being caught by the Moon, you all win!

The demand for window glass increased so much that William Stephens, a British businessman, saw the opportunity to expand his business in Portugal by investing in the glass industry.

In Stephens, players compete amongst one another in the role of master glassmakers working at the famous "Stephens" Factory to become the most prestigious figure in town...after Stephens, of course. Through clever and cunning planning, all players will develop their works, invest in new businesses, and promote the creation of jobs. Through a unique action-selection mechanism, on their turn players choose from a variety of options, either by activating the Stephens factory or by activating one of their personal investments.

The game ends when the Napoleonic forces arrive in town, at which time the player with the most prestige wins.

Author: Fernando Barbanoj

Playing time:120 minutes
Theme or setting:sci-fi, mining, exploration, planet, robots

Stress Botics Odyssey expands the heavy eurogame experience in 5 axes, while maintaining the basic rules and rhythm of the base game.

The first enhanced axis is the main room (the room where Alpha Bot currently is). Odyssey’s alternate board contains a zoom of the main room, and thus players will have to take into account their positioning, in order to fight against the cylindroids and defend Alpha Bot from them. If Alpha Bot does not reach the surface, deliveries to ships will be much more complex to execute!

The second enhanced axis are the Cylindroids. When the players eliminate an entire wave of enemies, a Cylindroid Elite will appear. This powerful enemy is Alpha Bot’s nemesis, and boasts its own AI and complex behaviour.

The third enhanced axis is Alpha Bot. Beta Bots will be able to access the interior of Alpha Bot through a new type of action. Once inside they will be able to control Alpha Bot's AI in order to speed up its behavior, change its direction to crush enemies or avoid obstacles, repair shields, collect resources or equip objects, among many other things. However, players will have to be cautious when interacting with AlphaBot... If it receives damage while being controlled, it will activate its other temperamental AI revealing one of its multiple aggressive behaviors, such as going back to an already explored main room or indiscriminately attacking any robot next to it!

The fourth enhanced axis is the Solo Mode. By adding Delta Bot, a small robot that will accompany us to fulfill our objectives, adventurous players can play the game on their own. Odyssey includes an additional board to be affixed to the player's blueprint in order to expand management during the maintenance phases, as well taking care of Delta Bot. If the little companion accumulates too much stress it will explode, making the game much harder for the solo player.

The fifth enhanced axis is additional content. Odyssey adds more items to the current sets, including a new type of item: the boxed items. Those can be dynamically equipped from the main room to be used more immediately, adding a touch of improvisation both to combat and to the strategies that structure the game. In addition, Odyssey includes modular boards that expand the detail of several mechanics and include unique characteristics in each player count.

Theme or setting:Venture even deeper into Siberia to explore the wilderness.

Return to the vast Siberian wilderness in this expansion for the beloved game by famous designer Andreas Steding: Stroganov.

 

As you cross the Turukhan River and establish new relationships with the local population, you will embark on new adventures that will spice up your game of Stroganov.

 

This expansion consists of 4 different modules. You can combine these at will to create a new gaming experience each time you play the game.

 

Module 1: The Siberian chipmunk introduced a new type of fur tile to collect. this might appear to have no apparent value at first, but a traveling merchant and collector will appear on the map, allowing you to exchange these rare furs for valuable advantages.

Module 2: The Hunting plans introduce a new way to help you fulfill the Tzar’s wishes. As you hunt for specific furs, you can spend hunting marker steps to lower the number of requested fur tiles on any Tzar’s Wish.

Module 3: New Landscapes adds two new types of landscape tiles to the game. The Characters count as a wild type of landscape tile and give you permanent abilities for the rest of the game once you acquire them. The sacred places introduce a fifth type of landscape and will earn you VP at the end of the game if you meet certain conditions.

Module 4: The Diplomacy track will allow you to trade with the locals by showing signs of good faith. The more generous you are, the more of an advantage you can win over your competitors. Time your actions well and earn many riches and fame.

Theme or setting:Arctic wilderness

As a faction of Arctic animals take over territories and stockpile food to survive the winter. Fight the cold, avoid humans, and escape the polar bears!

In Sub-Zero, you lead a faction of arctic animals chosen from Walrus, Goose, Musk Ox, Bald Eagle, Arctic Fox, and Lemming.
The first player of the turn rolls a set of dice indicating the actions available for that turn, the players in clockwise order choose which dice to use and remove it from the pool available to the others.
From the season's black dice set, you can then place your animals on the board, collect food from a territory and lower its value, use your faction's special action (each faction is different from the others), spend a point to choose a specific action of the dice
From the blue die of the season, freeze a territory by lowering its value, grow grass on a territory by raising its value, place a human scientific expedition on a territory, collect food, or send a Polar Bear against the animals of the other factions.
The game takes place in 15 rounds divided into 3 seasons: spring, summer, and autumn.
At each change of season, the actions guided by the dice make the game more and more "tiring" for the animals, decreasing the proliferation of animals, reducing the possibility of collecting food, increasing the possibility of the presence of ice, humans and bear attacks Polar

Food points are earned by maintaining a majority in territories, collecting food during the game, and collecting components for game objectives, which are selected at the start of the game.

At the end of the 3 seasons, the player with the most points will have won the game and let his faction's pets get through Sub-Zero's cold winter!

Suna Valo is a 2-player game by ode., illustrated by Lukas Siegmon. Like its predecessor Planta Nubo, it is set in the solarpunk world of Overgrown.

In Suna Valo, you have been chosen to build a thriving farm to contribute to the prosperity of the nearby settlement. You harvest grain, flowers and water lilies, collect eggs and energy stones and produce wool. You can then send your goods to the settlement by ship or use your nimble transport drones. The cleverly designed bots will also help you with your tasks.

Suna Valo is a medium game with a number of exciting mechanisms. Each time you bring a new card to your court, you activate an entire column of cards. This allows you to create increasingly powerful effects and make your farm flourish. Finally, you also have to earn the costs for the cards. Suna Valo has an original purchase mechanism. You set the prices for the cards yourself, but they also apply to the other player. So make sure you secure the right cards in good time before the other player gets hold of them or snatch the more valuable cards from the competition yourself.

The player with the most victory points at the end of the three rounds wins this peaceful competition!

Publisher: Perro Loko Games
Release date:09/2024

Theme or setting:A duel between Seth and Horus

According the some sources, each sunrise and sunset mark the backdrop for the perpetual battle between Horus and Seth. In this never-ending combat, Seth, god of darkness and chaos, prevails over Horus with the arrival of each night. However, in an eternal cycle of revenge, the victory of Horus, god of the sky, heralds the coming of each new day, continuing a cycle which has endured since the beginning of time.

In the game, Horus and Seth face each other in three locations: the world of the living (the Deshret), the underworld (the Duat) and the Sun Boat, or Mandjet, which symbolises the sun’s journey across the sky.

Sunrise Sunset is a competitive game for two opponents where in each round players take turns in playing cards (up to a total of 6 each) in order to gain control of the three locations. In each location the opponent with more power takes control.

The first player to deal three damage is the victor of the game.

Beginning with the starting player, the players take turns to play cards one after another until they have played all of their cards and assign it to one of the three lanes of your choice. The cards with stealth are played facedown, unlike the cards without stealth, which are played faceup.

If the card that you play has a placement ability, this is applied immediately.

Once each player has played all of their cards, determine who is the victor and loser in each lane. Apply all of the combat abilities of the units placed and add up the power of the cards which are placed in their area of the lane.

If a player deals 3 damage or more to their opponent at any moment, the game ends immediately.

INFO:
Author: Simone 'Aces' Morini
Illustrator: Lodovico Sartirana
Publisher: Aces Games
Vendor: Aces Games
Release date:07/2024
Playing Age:6 and up
Number of players:3 - 6
Retail price:19 €
Playing time:90 minutes
Theme or setting:Sweet Fantasy

Welcome to the Omnomn Island, brave warriors. Even if you’ve just landed, you’ve probably already noticed that the world around you has a… highly glycemic appearance.

 

Trees with spun sugar foliage, flour deserts, swamps of boiling eggs. And then, of course, there’s YOU. The Warries, those who will have to face the demons aiming to devour your beautiful, sweet land.

 

Get ready to take your weapons out of the oven and destroy EVIL!

 

Sweet Cherry Pie VS Evil: Setting
“The RPG Frowned upon by 9 out of 10 Dentists”

As already mentioned, Sweet Cherry Pie VS Evil takes place on Omnom Island, featuring places like the Scrublands, the Alpoven, the Marzivillies, and so on; in short, a paradisiacal land that resembles the backdrop of a star-studded pastry shop.

 

Omnom Island is inhabited by the Nomns, beings born from the wise (and natural) fusion of flour, yeast, eggs, and secret ingredients, and organized into Lineages, each of which is formed by four sub-clans. For example, the Ovenians gather all those Nomns forged by the fire and warmth of the Alpoven. Moving instead towards the colder side of the island, we find the Frostish, and then the Semifreddos and the Halfcookeds.

 

Each Nomns respects their land and, above all, their peers, and they all live in harmony nourishing themselves and being nourished by the sugary land that gave them life… all this at least until the arrival of Evil.

 

A fateful day indeed, Omnom Island was invaded by the Gluttonies, demons with only one purpose: to devour everything, with a predilection for the Nomns.

 

And it is here that instead of hiding inside ovens or freezers, some Nomns decided to take on the role of Warries, protectors of Omnom Island dedicated to annihilating the spreading Evil.

 

Sweet Cherry Pie VS Evil: The Game System
“The Only Complexity lies in the Carbohydrates”

The rules of Sweet Cherry Pie VS Evil are as simple as breaking an egg (intentionally or not).

First of all, the game does not use dice (let’s leave the cubes for the stock). In fact, checks are carried out by randomly opening the pages of the corebook, each of which has a frame called Scoop, detailed with the check outcome: What a Mess! (critical failure), Does Not Look Good (failure), It’s Still Good! (success but…) and Yummy! (success).

 

The outcome of a check can also be modified by spending Ingredient Fragments, namely the stats that make up the Character.

  • Leavening/Combativity

  • Butter/Wits

  • Eggs/Endurance

  • Sugar/Wisdom

  • Milk/Willpower

Depending on the outcome, the character may decide to spend a certain number of Fragments of the relevant Ingredient to gain a bonus, moving the Scoop to the desired result.

Ingredient Fragments are also used to attack, cast spells and… stay alive. In fact, when three of a Character’s Ingredient Fragments reach 0, they meet an inevitable death.

 

COMBAT

During combat, each character can perform an action in turn. However, opponents don’t follow the same sequence; they attack only after all characters have made their actions, with a penalty based on how much damage they have taken during the turn.

 

SCOOP ALTERNATIVES

Don’t want to use the Scoop, maybe ‘cause you don’t want to ruin your precious corebook? Or are you not in a position to pass it on to your fellow adventurers? In that case you can roll 1d8 and compare the result with the conversion table provided.
S_ORDER: SWEET CHERRY PIE VS EVIL: COREBOOK
TITEL: Sweet Cherry Pie VS Evil: Corebook

Du und deine Konkurrenten habt hart gearbeitet, um hier zu stehen, und der Konditormeister kann es nicht erwarten zu sehen, wie ihr mit seinen berühmten Rezepten zurechtkommt. Die Küche von Sweet Mess ist durch und durch chaotisch. Arbeite klüger und effizienter als deine Mitbewerber und du gewinnst vielleicht den Wettbewerb!

Spielüberblick:
Im Verlauf des Wettbewerbs sammelt ihr Zutaten aus Schalen, bereitet Rezepte vor und stellt sie fertig, um Auszeichnungen zu erhalten. Je mehr Rezepte ihr fertigstellt, desto kunstfertiger werdet und desto mehr Punkte erhaltet ihr. Für taktische Vorteile könnt ihr spezielle Küchenmaschinen und Goldene Taler nutzen. Und jetzt nichts wie ran ans Gebäck.

Heute Morgen sind die Astronautentiere aufgewacht und haben gemerkt, dass ihre Träume verschwunden sind! Aber die Sterne sind schlau. Sie zeigen den Tieren den Weg, um von einem Bild zum anderen zu fliegen und ihre Träume wiederzufinden. 

In diesem edukativen Spiel geht es um Silben. Das Feld zeigt ein Bild. Jetzt geht es darum, ein Wort zum Bild zu finden. Die Anzahl Silben definieren die Anzahl Schritte. So weit kann sich die Figur bewegen. Aber wohin? Auf ein Feld mit einem Stern der Spielerfarbe. Dabei lernt das Kind auch neue, lange und kurze Wörter und Synonyme. Denn Synonyme bringen einen Vorteil. Nicht das Zählen steht im Vordergrund, sondern die Silben. Ab 4 Jahren für 2 – 4 Kinder.

Das Spiel bzw. das Holz und Papier als Grundstoffe des Spielmaterials und der Box stammen aus FSC zertifiziertem Anbau.

The stories were adapted with the utmost fidelity to the original text, in order to allow you an interactive immersion in the style of the Master of the Supernatural, by using a narration with paths, where, armed with a die and a pencil, you will travel through the streets of Kingsport facing monstrous creatures, exploring nightmarish territories and crossing the border that divides dream from reality. The Necronomicon Gamebook - Kadath will take you to the dark heart of the Dreamlands, where the truce between the nightmare priests is about to shatter.

Nyarlathotep, the Crawling Chaos, wants to awaken his lord, Azathoth the Daemon Sultan that bubbles at the center of all infinity.

Our reality exists only in the broken mind of this primal entity, consumed by its own power. Awakening the Greatest God could mean the end of everything.

However, Azathoth is not the only sleeping abomination upon which the fate of all existence hangs. Cthulhu, a blasphemous deity who waits dreaming in the lost underwater city of R'lyeh, does not accept the end of his oniric sovereignty.

And here you come in, attracted by an ancestral call during the ritual that every century opens a bridge towards the Dreamlands, you will go beyond the boundaries of time and space to move the needle of the Armageddon.

TOSSIT 2024 - RINGS OF GLORY Board: Celebrate the Paris 2024 Olympics in Your Own Way

Overview:
Immerse yourself in the spirit of the Paris 2024 Olympics with the exclusive TOSSIT 2024 - RINGS OF GLORY Board. As the world’s top athletes gather to showcase their skills, you can join in the celebration from home with this limited-edition board—only 180 pieces produced! This is not just a game, but a collectible, a piece of the Olympics that you can own, touch, and play. Designed to bring the excitement of the Games to life with every throw, the RINGS OF GLORY Board captures the essence of competition in a unique and engaging way.

Gameplay Highlights:

Olympic Colors and Target Rings:
The RINGS OF GLORY Board is adorned with the iconic colors of the Olympic Games, inviting you to aim for Gold, Silver, and Bronze. Landing on the red, white, or blue rings scores you 3, 2, or 1 point, respectively, bringing the thrill of Olympic competition straight into your living room.

Premium Material and Design:
Crafted from 100% food-grade silicone, this board offers unmatched durability and flexibility. The powerful suction cups ensure a secure grip on any surface, allowing you to play anywhere—indoors or outdoors. The double-sided design not only enables Olympic-style challenges but can also be flipped over to enjoy the classic TOSSIT games you know and love.

Exclusive Limited Edition:
With only 180 units produced, the RINGS OF GLORY Board is a highly exclusive collectible. Once these boards are gone, they are gone forever—don’t miss your chance to own a piece of the Paris 2024 Olympics.

New Game Modes:
The board introduces five new games, perfect for family-friendly fun or competitive parties. It’s the ideal addition to any gathering, whether you’re enjoying a relaxed afternoon with family or a thrilling party with friends.

Why You’ll Love It:
The TOSSIT 2024 - RINGS OF GLORY Board blends the heritage of petanque and darts with a touch of Olympic prestige. It’s not just a game, but a tribute to the spirit of competition and the joy of play. This exclusive board comes with a high-quality silicone mat (45 cm x 50 cm) and is ready to elevate your TOSSIT experience to the next level. Act fast and secure your piece to celebrate the Paris 2024 Olympics in style.

Ready for Glory?
Pave your way to victory with every throw—just TOSSIT! The RINGS OF GLORY Board is set to ship in time for the opening of the Olympic Games. Don’t miss out on this unique opportunity to bring a piece of the Olympics into your home.

TOSSIT DOMINION - A Novel Strategy Game Experience

Overview:

TOSSIT DOMINION is a dynamic strategy game that brings a new level of depth and excitement to the world of tabletop gaming. Combining the tactical decisions of territory control with the skillful precision of dart throwing, this game challenges players to outthink and outplay their opponents in a race for dominance.

Gameplay Highlights:

  • Territorial Conquest: The heart of TOSSIT DOMINION lies in its competitive territory control. Players must strategically choose where to place their darts, aiming to conquer key zones on the board. Each throw matters, as the placement of your darts determines your influence over the battlefield.

  • Multi-layered Strategy: Victory isn’t just about scoring points. Players must balance between aggressive attacks, solid defenses, and opportunistic plays. With multiple paths to victory—be it through accumulating points, securing critical symbols, or outright domination—the game keeps everyone on their toes.

  • Interactive and Unpredictable: TOSSIT DOMINION is a game of constant change. The board setup can vary each game, creating new challenges and opportunities. As players vie for control, the dynamics of the game shift with each round, ensuring no two games are ever the same.

  • Challenging Gameplay: Whether you're plotting to eliminate your rivals, aiming to capture essential symbols, or striving for the highest score, TOSSIT DOMINION offers a rich, challenging experience that rewards both strategic foresight and precise execution. Every decision counts, making the game as intellectually engaging as it is thrilling.

Why You'll Love It:

TOSSIT DOMINION is not just another game—it's an intense battle of wits and skill that will keep players coming back for more. The interplay of strategy, timing, and precision creates a unique experience where the outcome is never certain until the very last throw. It’s the perfect game for those who love to challenge their mind and test their competitive edge.

Discover the thrill of TOSSIT DOMINION at the next board game exhibition in Germany, and experience firsthand why this game is set to become a new classic in strategy gaming.

Limited Expansion Pack - Exklusive Farben für dein TOSSIT-Erlebnis

Überblick:
Bei TOSSIT lieben wir Farben. Unser Limited Expansion Pack bietet speziell designte Darts in sieben faszinierenden Farben, die dein Spielerlebnis auf ein neues Level heben. Von der ruhigen Gelassenheit des Lavendels bis zur kraftvollen Energie des Original Orange—jede Farbe wurde sorgfältig ausgewählt, um einzigartige Themen und Emotionen widerzuspiegeln. Diese limitierte Auflage umfasst nur 1.800 Sets pro Farbe, was sie besonders exklusiv macht. Diese Darts sind mehr als nur Spielzubehör, sie sind ein Statement, das deinem TOSSIT-Set eine persönliche Note verleiht.

Gameplay Highlights:

Exklusive Farben:
Jedes Set enthält drei Darts in einer von sieben einzigartigen Farben. Diese Farben sind nicht nur ästhetisch ansprechend, sondern wurden auch entwickelt, um spezifische Stimmungen und Emotionen zu vermitteln. Ob du dein Set mit der beruhigenden Wirkung von Lavendel oder der dynamischen Kraft von Orange ausstatten möchtest, diese Farben bereichern dein Spiel und bringen frischen Wind in jede Partie.

Limitierte Auflage:
Mit nur 1.800 Sets pro Farbe ist dieses Expansion Pack streng limitiert. Diese Exklusivität macht die Darts zu begehrten Sammlerstücken, die sich ideal für Enthusiasten eignen, die ihrem TOSSIT-Spiel eine besondere Note verleihen wollen. Die limitierte Auflage garantiert, dass du ein wirklich einzigartiges Set besitzt.

Sammlerwert:
Das Limited Expansion Pack ist perfekt für Sammler. Die hochwertigen Darts sind nicht nur funktional, sondern auch optisch ein Highlight. Sie fügen deinem TOSSIT-Set nicht nur Stil hinzu, sondern machen jede Partie zu einem besonderen Erlebnis.

Perfekt für persönliche Akzente:
Dieses Set ermöglicht es dir, deine Spiele individuell zu gestalten. Wähle die Farbe, die am besten zu deiner Persönlichkeit oder deinem Spielstil passt, und mache jedes Match zu einem Ausdruck deines eigenen Stils. Diese Darts bringen nicht nur Farbe ins Spiel, sondern auch Leidenschaft und Individualität.

Warum du es lieben wirst:
Das Limited Expansion Pack von TOSSIT ist mehr als nur eine Erweiterung—es ist eine Möglichkeit, deinem Spiel eine persönliche Note zu verleihen. Die Mischung aus exklusiven Farben, limitierter Auflage und hochwertiger Verarbeitung macht dieses Set zu einem Muss für jeden TOSSIT-Fan. Wähle deine Farbe, setze ein Zeichen und spiele mit Leidenschaft!

Entdecke die Vielfalt und Exklusivität des Limited Expansion Packs auf der nächsten Spielemesse in Deutschland und erfahre selbst, warum diese Erweiterung das Potenzial hat, ein Favorit unter Sammlern und Spielbegeisterten zu werden.

TOSSIT Party Pack - Maximum Fun for Your Parties

Overview:
Our fans asked for more TOSSITs in a set, and we answered! Now you can get 26 TOSSIT Darts in one box, allowing you to play with your whole family or in the office break room. This pack is perfect for 4 to 8 players and is ideal for parties! It also unlocks all our game modes.

What's Included in This Set:

  • 2 Black Jack Darts: Target darts that set the position for the other darts, similar to boccia.

  • 24 TOSSIT Darts: Soft darts with powerful suction cups that stick to smooth surfaces.

  • 1 Practical Cotton Carry Bag: Perfect for transporting and storing your darts.

Gameplay Highlights:

Extensive Play Options:
The TOSSIT Party Pack is designed for larger groups, allowing you to play with 4 to 8 players. This set gives you access to all our game modes, offering endless new challenges. Whether you’re playing indoors on smooth surfaces like floors, windows, or countertops, or outdoors, the possibilities are limitless.

Perfect for Parties and Large Gatherings:
With 26 TOSSIT Darts in one box, this set is ideal for parties, team-building events, or large family gatherings. Having more darts and more players means more fun and excitement. It’s the perfect set to make any gathering unforgettable and to bring excitement to every participant.

Versatile Use:
TOSSIT isn’t just for home play—it’s also used in schools, physiotherapy, and nursing homes to promote coordination, movement, and social interaction. This makes it ideal for all age groups and abilities, offering fun and benefits in various settings.

High-Quality Materials:
Our darts are made from 100% food-grade silicone, with not a single drop of plastic. They are safe, eco-friendly, and dishwasher-safe, making them easy to clean. The darts come in several vibrant colors with a matte finish, adding a unique touch to every game.

Addictive Fun and Social Media Buzz:
TOSSIT darts are not just fun—they're incredibly addictive! The combination of skill, strategy, and a bit of luck provides hours of entertainment. It's no wonder that TOSSIT has gone viral on social media! Plus, TOSSIT is now available in many stores, making it easy to get your hands on a set.

Why You’ll Love It:
The TOSSIT Party Pack offers endless fun and is the perfect choice for large groups and parties. It’s versatile, easy to carry, and perfect for any setting. Whether you’re an experienced player or new to TOSSIT, this set gives you everything you need to fully enjoy the game.

Discover the TOSSIT Party Pack and see why this set is perfect for large groups and parties. Available at your favorite store or online—start your TOSSIT adventure today!

Kings of Ruin is a new stand-alone story campaign from the team behind the acclaimed Tainted Grail board game, set in the same universe. Playable with a brand new set of exciting characters, it continues the stories of Fall of Avalon, Last Knight, and Age of Legends while also providing a perfect self-contained entry into the saga for new players.

During your experience with the game you will explore new land (with a totally changed system of traveling through Wyrdness), solve encounters with force or diplomacy with unique puzzle card system, and develop your heroes with new passive skills, cards and powerful items.

Most importantly, you will discover a dark immersive story of abandoned land at the wrong side of Avalon and Kings of Ruin ruling there: Claudyne, the Unknighted. Amberqueen Veneda. Nonus, Bishop of the Deep.

Author: Antoine Bauza/Corentin Lebrat
Illustrator: Alexandre Roux/Picksel
Publisher: Bombyx/Matagot
Release date:08/2024
Playing Age:8 and up
Number of players:2 - 4
Retail price:25 €
Playing time:20 minutes
Theme or setting:Nature, animals

Get green fingers… or yellow, or pink, or blue!

Welcome apprentice gardener to the bamboo plantation. Your role is essential: to make this place a paradise of a thousand colors, planted with bamboos… for the happiness of the pandas!
Roll the markers. Each player picks up one in turn and colors in one item on their sheet that matches the color and the symbol on their chosen marker.
But which markers to leave to the other players, and which elements to color to score the most points? It's all down to opportunism, depending on the options on the table and the time your opponents leave you to complete your collections and get your ladybugs back!
Will you choose your bamboo? Your sun? Your river? The choice is yours.

Licensed use of the ColorADD code that allows colorblind people to identify colors.

  • A roll & write in the universe of Takenoko.

  • Colored markers are used as dice!

  • Different levels of difficulty.

Takenokolor is co-edited with Matagot.

Author: Avalon Hill
Publisher: Avalon Hill

Release date:10/2024
Playing Age:12 and up
Number of players:2 - 6

Playing time:100 minutes

Wenn das Schicksal der Welt bedroht ist, werden Feinde zu Verbündeten. Beim kooperativen Spiel „Talisman Allianzen: Ruf des Schicksals“ gilt es, sich mit anderen Spielern zu verbünden, um bei einem epischen Abenteuer 5 gewagte Prüfungen zu bestehen. Bei jeder Prüfung müssen die Spieler 2 Talismane auf Orten der Macht platzieren, das Siegel des Portals der Macht öffnen und sich dem Gegner dieser Herausforderung stellen. Mit einer Fülle von möglichen Szenarien bietet diese Erweiterung zum Talisman Strategiespiel ein unbegrenztes Spielerlebnis. Enthält 30 Startkarten, Untergangsleiste, Untergangsmarker, Regelheft, 24 doppelseitige Marker (Stärke/Talent), 5 Schachteln mit 5 Figuren, 4 Umschläge mit 20 Karten. (Talisman 5. Edition Basisspiel erforderlich. Separat erhältlich.)

Willkommen im magischen Land Talisman! Talismane, Artefakte einer anderen Welt, sind erneut auf die Ebene der Sterblichen hinabgekehrt und signalisieren den Anbruch einer neuen Ära − und den Ruf nach einem neuen Herrscher. Bei „Talisman: Die magische Suche − 5. Edition“ begeben sich die Spieler auf ein spannendes Abenteuer mit dem Ziel, einen Talisman zu erobern, die Krone der Herrschaft in der Mitte des Spielbretts zu erreichen und den Drachen zu bezwingen. Mit einer Vielzahl an Spielfiguren und vielen möglichen Szenarien bietet dieses Strategiespiel Jugendlichen und Erwachsene grenzenlose Abenteuer. Enthält ein großes Spielbrett, 12 Spielfiguren, 12 Charakterkarten, 100 Abenteuerkarten, 24 Zauberspruchkarten, 18 Kaufkarten, 4 Talismankarten, 1 Krötenkarte, 6 Krötenmarker, 114 Spielmarker, 38 Schicksalsmarker, 12 Gesinnungsmarker, 30 Goldstücke, 3 sechsseitige Würfel und Regelheft.

Authors: Pierpaolo Paoletti, Francesco Testini
Illustrators: Andrew Bosley, Sergio Chaves
Publisher: ThunderGryph Games
Release date:10/2024
Playing Age:14 and up
Number of players:1 - 4
Retail price:50 €
Playing time:45 minutes
Theme or setting:The Tang dynasty was considered the first golden age of the classical and now iconic Chinese gardens. Emperor Xuanzong built the magnificent imperial Garden of the Majestic Clear Lake as an homage of life itself and from where he ruled. Players will act as Imperial Garden Designers and they will be called to build the most incredible garden while balancing the elements of Nature.

The roofs of the villages of the Tang Dynasty are the first to notice the slightest temperature changes and the passing of time. The wind blows, raising dry leaves that fly before the snow covers every architecture. After several days the air starts smelling like pollen and gets warmer, the flowers start blooming again, and the sun dries the mud into cracked earth once again.

Tang Garden: Seasons is the final expansion for Tang Garden. We have crafted different rich scenarios by getting inspiration from the mechanisms you most love in board games that will completely change the way you create your beautiful garden. In this expansion, you will find new tiles, decorations, panoramas, visitors, boards, and new components that you have never seen before.

Author: Lim Ming Liang
Illustrators: Ly Uyen Linh, Phan Ha Tu Mi
Publisher: Ameba games
Release date:12/2023
Playing Age:14 and up
Number of players:2
Retail price:35 €
Playing time:45 minutes
Theme or setting:Europe World War 2

Immerse yourself in battle with 6 iconic World War 2 tanks!

Tank Clash is a casual warfare strategy game for 2 players that a noob or skilled player can enjoy. It features a checkers-style armour tracking system with dice rolling and hand management for tactical choices.

Take command of fearsome German tanks like the Panzer IV, Marder III and Tiger I. In the early stages of the war, Germany tank offensives in Poland and France proved that armour was essential for victory.

Although the Germans created very formidable tanks, the Americans managed to use innovative tactics and its industrial might to turn the tide of the war. They built the M4 Sherman, M18 Hellcat and M26 Pershing to counter them.

This tank skirmish game is designed to be easy-to-learn, quick to setup and played within an hour. Replayability is high as there are different secret missions, morale cards and modular terrain boards.

Author: Cole Smith
Illustrator: Catalyst Labs
Publisher: Elznir Games
Vendor: JoeKas World GmbH
Release date:06/2024
Playing Age:8 and up
Number of players:3 - 6
Retail price:17.95 €
Playing time:20 minutes
Theme or setting:Japan, Mythologie, Anime

Die legendären Tanuki, oder zu Deutsch „Marderhunde“ gelten in der japanischen Folklore als schelmische und lustige Meister der Tarnung.

Die Tanuki müssen sich beeilen, denn der Winter naht. Sie wetteifern darum, den größten Vorrat an Bambus anzusammeln und schrecken auch nicht davor zurück, auf die Dienste von Banditen, Ninjas, Geishas und vielen anderen Charakteren zurückzugreifen, um am Ende als Sieger zu triumphieren.

Lässt du dich von deinen Gefühlen überwältigen und gehst zur Rache über oder pflegst du lieber deinen Garten?

Tanuki ist ein aufregendes und schnelles Take-That-Spiel voller Samurais, Geishas, Ninjas … und vielen niedlich flauschigen Wesen. Die Spieler wetteifern darum, den ertragreichsten Bambusgarten anzulegen.

Hierzu spielt der aktive Spieler in jeder Runde eine Karte aus: Entweder eine Aktionskarte, deren Effekt er sofort abhandelt, oder eine Charakterkarte, die er in seinen Garten legt.

Durch geschicktes Ausspielen der richtigen Karte zum passenden Zeitpunkt gewinnt der Spieler so Bambus.

Nur der Spieler mit dem meisten Bambus feiert die gelungene Ernte als Sieger.

Author: Ludovic Lepine
Illustrator: Philippe Nouhra
Publisher: Funforge
Release date:10/2024
Playing Age:8 and up
Number of players:2
Retail price:22 €
Playing time:15 minutes
Theme or setting:abstract 2 players game

As the sun sets on the spanish landscape, this is time for TAPAS!

An abstract 2 player game which will make you hungry for more and more!

Tapas is an abstract game that captures the essence of Spanish tapas culture in a strategic battle between two players. The game is set on a vibrant board adorned with thick and colorful tiles representing 2 different tapas dishes, the spicy Jalapeños and the crunchy Croquetas.

During the game, players take turns strategically placing their Tapas to outwit their opponent, moving all the Tapas present on their line as they enter the board. The objective? Pushing away their opponent Tapas' to claim them and have the more points at the end of the game. But be careful not to delight your opponent with your own Tapas by mistake.

4 possible boards and multiple variations thanks to surprise tiles bringing sauces and other ways to make tricks.

Die Vogelinsel liegt ruhig und eingeschneit da. Schnee rieselt leise auf den Hafen und das Segelschiff „Jan van Gent“. Der Weihnachtsmann stapft über den schneebedeckten Strand, in der Ferne spielt leise Weihnachtsmusik. Plötzlich fällt ein lauter Schuss!

Ermittelt in einem realistischen Krimifall.

Öffnet den Umschlag und lest euch den Startzettel aufmerksam durch. Hört euch die Audioaufnahme an. Schaut euch alle Beweismittel im Spiel gemeinsam an, erkennt Zusammenhänge und überprüft die Alibis.

Rettet das Weihnachtsfest auf der Vogelinsel!

Moin Moin, ich bin Manni, die Möwe. Ich lebe im Küstenstädtchen Nordersiel und brauche eure Hilfe bei der Aufklärung eines Verbrechens. Im Aufzuchtbecken der Robbenstation werden kleine Robbenbabys aufgepäppelt, bis sie wieder in die Freiheit entlassen werden können. Doch immer wieder wird das Wasserbecken sabotiert und die Robbenbabys in ernste Gefahr gebracht. Helft mir herauszufinden, wer diese Verbrechen begeht und beschützt mit mir gemeinsam die kleinen Robben!

Das neue Familienspiel aus dem Hause Stonemaier Games führt uns auf eine Briefmarkenbörse.

Alle sammeln und tauschen Briefmarken, um sie schließlich möglichst schön in das eigene Sammelalbum einzusortieren und punkteträchtig zu präsentieren.

Der besondere Clou sind die Tausch- und die Wertungsphase. Wie gestaltet man das eigene Tauschangebot möglichst attraktiv für die anderen? Welche Wertung nutzt man zuerst und welche lässt man aus?

In jeder Runde gibt es eine kleine zufällige Regeländerung. Zusammen mit der großen Anzahl an Wertungskarten, von denen immer nur wenige ins Spiel kommen, garantieren diese Regeländerungen, dass keine Partie Tauschrausch genau wie die nächste ist.

Tauschrausch ist ein interaktives Familienspiel mit spannenden Kniffen.

ages 8+ | 2-4 Players | 20min.

The player using taxi. The player pieces are mounted piggyback on neutral "carriers". On your turn, you roll up to three dice, aiming for 4 or less one die at a time. If you get 4 or less on two dice, you move twice the amount, As pieces move, they push those in front of them on the track. There are two exit tracks where you get to push pieces over the side.

Author: Tomáš Holek
Illustrator: Barbora Srp Žižková
Publisher: Albi
Release date:10/2024
Playing Age:12 and up
Number of players:2 - 4
Retail price:52 €
Playing time:90 minutes
Theme or setting:Ancient

Tea Garden is a medium-weight euro-style game by Tomáš Holek. Tomáš is technically a debuting author, but at this year’s Spiel he’ll introduce three of his designs – Tea Garden one of them, the other two being SETI from Czech Games Edition and Galileo Galileo from Pink Troubadour. It might be a first time that someone is debuting with three complex strategic games simultaneously.

Tea Garden is for 2 to 4 players of age 12 and up with a play time around 90 minutes. It takes you on a journey back to the early days of tea cultivation in ancient China. The basic gameplay mechanism is deck-building. With their cards the players will perform a variety of actions that will allow them to collect victory points. However, one of the most interesting parts is the management of tea leaves themselves (they serve as one of the game’s resources): divided into fresh and fermented - and while the fresh ones lose quality at the end of each round, the fermented ones gain it.

Tea Garden, wonderfully illustrated by Barbora Žižková, will be released on 3rd of October, the very day the Essen Spiel Begins.

Vendor: Blackrock Games

Playing time:20 minutes
Theme or setting:archeologists

Face rival archeologists in a race to unlock an ancient temple's forgotten secrets. Before you can lay hands on the invaluable treasure it's holding, you have to deduce the combinations of statuettes unlocking the hidden vault!

At the beginning of Temple Code, each player receives a combination card with a series of three unique statuettes that everyone can see but themselves. Each round, two combination cards are dealt face-up in front of each player. On your turn, pick a set of cards in front of another player, then take one for yourself and give them the other one. By aligning this card next to the one you're trying to guess, you will get hints about the matching statuettes: each blue circle indicates a statuette that is on both cards at the same place, and each orange triangle stands for a statuette that is on both cards, but in different positions.

At any time during the game, a player can guess the card in front of them. Whether they guessed correctly or not, they receive a new combination card to guess.

Whoever first correctly guesses two combinations wins.

Author: Michele Quondam
Publisher: Giochix.it
Release date:10/2024
Playing Age:14 and up
Number of players:1 - 4
Retail price:89 €
Playing time:88 minutes
Theme or setting:Dungeon crawler

A mighty artifact is hidden in a forgotten Temple.
An obscure spell makes it unreachable. The only way to break this arcane magic is to find the tombs of the Evil Champions, which rest in the Temple, evocate them and defeat all of them!
Find the Artifact and escape from the Temple before all Evil creatures dwelling there wake up!
Explore an ancient dungeon, avoid traps, kill monsters, challenge Bosses, grab treasures, gain Experience points, increase your character abilities.

Temple of Horrors is an innovative dungeon crawler game for 1-4 players, which lasts about 90 minutes, where typical Euro game mechanicals mix with the American style.

In ToH, players create the dungeon map directly, choosing which tile place from their available display when their Hero explores a new area. By creating large Rooms of the same type, players will increase their chances to find clues about the Artifact position. Placing or not, particular game Rooms, from Library to Trap Rooms, or Treasure, Healing, Monster Rooms, will determine their chance of survival.
Activating the Tombs Rooms, players will be able to fight mighty Bosses and find Clues. Combining Clues, they will discover the Artefact position, and if they will able to take it and escape from the Temple in time, they will win.
Escape? Not so easy! After entering the Temple, the Entrance collapsed. So players must find a secondary exit. Different in each game, an ancient Map will reveal the path they have to take to find it.
The game can last up to 14 rounds. In every round, the opponents will be stronger and more challenging to win.

You can play the game also in PvP mode. In this case, one or more hidden players will try secretly to win alone, distract the rest of the party on a false path, and grab the Artifact. This kind of game adds a lot of RPG aspects to the game.

Each Hero has their powers and abilities and can improve them during the game, gaining experience points, choosing how: by this way, each Hero is different in every game. Magic Items, potions, weapons will improve and differentiate each character more.

The Lost Artifact is one of the 100 different Adventures of the game! Each Adventure is playable multiple times by players, and each play will always be different!

Are you ready for the challenge?

“This game is my tribute to my wonderful Dungeons and Dragons game sessions. Enjoy it!” (M. Quondam).

Prelude 2 is a new expansion for Terraforming Mars that can only be played together with Terraforming Mars and Prelude (1) exapansion.

The expansion is focused on enriching the cross-expansion game experience, which means that many of the cards may only be played in combination with either Venus Next, Colonies, or Turmoil. It also introduces prelude cards with actions and effects.

Prelude 2 includes 5 new corporations, 25 prelude cards, and 24 project cards.

Author: Jeffrey CCH
Illustrators: Arepko, Roxy Dai, Samuel Horowitz, Nilanjan Malakar, Amanda Phelps, Domingo Pino
Publisher: ICE Makes
Release date:11/2023
Playing Age:14 and up
Number of players:2 - 4
Retail price:70 €
Playing time:45 minutes
Theme or setting:Horror movie-like

On a stormy night, a couple of unfortunate travelers rushed into an abandoned mansion in the woods to take shelter. But even worse than the merciless rain, they have in fact, accidentally entered the hunting ground of a bloodthirsty killer…

Terrorscape is a team-based asymmetric horror game. You could take the roles of the survivors or the killer. Survivors cooperate to escape the mansion by searching for 5 keys or repairing the radio to make an emergency call. The killer is solely against the survivors. The killer needs to locate the survivors by their noise or by skills and decide how to eliminate them.

In a game of survivors, you hide under the sight of the killer and be careful that some action may make noise. You can also draw cards to find items in some locations so as to equip yourself well for the fight. Most importantly, survivors look for keys or repair the radio to make an emergency call aiming to ultimately escape from the nightmare.

On the other side, the killer hunts the survivors with unforgiving abilities. The killer needs to manage well your hand to plan for actions: move, sense, spread fear, block doors......etc. When the killers encounter the survivors, a battle of life and death begins!

With various characters of killers and survivors, each match is diversified! Each of the characters has their own skills, playstyles, and their own miniatures. Killers, enjoy your hunt! Survivors, play smart and outplay your opponent! Roll a show with blood and fear!

Author: James Firnhaber
Illustrator: Denis Freitas
Publisher: Asmodee
Vendor: Asmodee Deutschland
Release date:12/2024
Playing Age:14 and up
Number of players:1 - 4
Retail price:0.00 €
Playing time:75 minutes
Theme or setting:Science Fiction

The Tesseract appeared in our skies six days ago, over the exact magnetic north of the planet. It was the size of a city block. Since that time it has been condensing, collapsing upon itself. It can now fit into the palm of your hand.

Tesseract is a compelling, cooperative dice-manipulation game for 1 to 4 players. The focal point of the game is a block of 64 dice, the Tesseract, which sits at the center of the board on a raised platform. Players will remove cubes to place in their individual labs, transfer them as needed to others, adjust the cube's values and, importantly, isolate the cubes into the containment matrix, neutralizing them.

To Contain a cube a player must have in their lab 3 or more cubes all of one value (a Set) or in sequence (a Run), either all of one color or having none of the same colors. By filling the containment matrix completely (24 total unique dice) they will stop the reaction and win the game. But if the Tesseract has its last cube removed beforehand - or if 7 breaches occur, the game is lost and our world ceases to exist.

Asymetric character abilities include a passive, 'always on' ability and a unique action that is only available to that player. Research cards earned during play help give players an edge, as do the even more powerful Containment cards, unlocked from the matrix.

Tesseract is a very challenging co-op game, with lots of replay value built into the number of characters and various threat platforms which govern the difficulty. The game scales remarkably well and has a solo mode that is every bit as engaging. The tension mounts quickly as the Tesseract sheds cubes at the end of every player's turn, primes them and potentially causes Breaches to occur, bringing us closer to disaster.

Tethys is a collaborative space dungeon crawler where you, along with your teammates, must explore the mining colony on the surface of Saturn's moon, Tethys, complete missions and defeat the Alien Queen. At each turn, you will open new rooms, face fearsome aliens, conquer new weapons, modifiers and items that will enhance your arsenal: your precious dice. Find and open the chests to receive loot and access codes that will lead you to unexplored places, until you discover the underground hangar that hides a terrible truth ...

During your turn, you can perform 2 Actions, Move and Attack, as well as collect loot and open rooms.

If you complete the mission objective, you win!
If, on the other hand, you and all the players who participated in the mission lose all Energy, bringing the battery to 0, the Mission has failed.

Author: Georg Schumacher

Publisher: moses. Verlag
Release date:08/2024
Playing Age:12 and up
Number of players:1 - 5
Retail price:9.95 €
Playing time:15 minutes
Theme or setting:Denglisch

'„Oh boy!“, denkt ihr euch jedes Mal, wenn wieder ein typisch deutscher Spruch kommt? Dann ist das neue Denglisch-Quiz exactly right für euch. Ob auf einer britischen Teeparty oder im Pub: Here steps the bear! Es warten über 75 unterhaltsame denglische Sprüche und Wörter darauf, von euch übersetzt zu werden. Könnt ihr erraten, welches englische Gegenstück sich dahinter verbirgt? Dieses britische Quizspiel is the absolute crasher!

Endlich gibt es einen neuen Titel unserer beliebten Spielereihe rund um (d)englische Redewendungen. 75 unterhaltsame denglische Sprüche und Begriffe bieten unterhaltsamen Spielspaß. Wer schafft es, die denglischen Sprüche und Wörter in korrektes Englisch zu übersetzen? Und kennen die Spielenden auch die vermeintlich englischen Begriffe, die es im Englischen gar nicht gibt? Ob allein oder im Team – dieses Quiz bietet Ratespaß für die ganze Familie.

So wird's gespielt:

+ Die Spielenden übersetzen reihum die denglischen Sprüche ins Deutsche.

+ Bei einer richtigen Antwort gilt es, die korrekte englische Redewendung herauszufinden.

+ Für jede richtige Antwort gibt es einen Punkt.

+ Wer am Ende die meisten Punkte hat, gewinnt.

Author: Arya Wirahadi & Yusak Arief
Illustrator: Liliana Harefa
Publisher: Tabletoys Games
Release date:10/2024
Playing Age:10 and up
Number of players:4 - 8
Retail price:25 €
Playing time:30 minutes
Theme or setting:Friendship

Are you the nerd, the jock, the princess, or the weirdo of the group? You'll find out in That’s You, a simple game about letting your friends know exactly what you think about them.

In this game, a Clue Giver will be secretly assigned one out of six traits on the table that she will have to indicate to the other players. The Clue Giver must clue in the other players by indicating which among them are the most likely and least likely to be associated with the trait. The players then work together to try and interpret the clues and figure out which trait was selected. If they succeed, they get points!

This game will give you and your friends a chance to find out who you really, truly are inside -- or who you appear to be to your friends, at least. If the description doesn’t fit anybody else…That’s You!

Stranded on a desert island - in the middle of the ocean! A group of young people have to find their way around on their own. Eat, sleep, make decisions - how will the adventure end? One after the other and without talking to each other, three to five players play cards until the mission is completed. A game board, suspension markers and special cards help to keep track of the game and offer opportunities to influence the course of the mission. A co-operative crew feeling in which everyone is in demand. A family game with a captivating story that provides thrills.

Author: n.a.

You are surviving members of the Blades, a legendary group who long protected the Empire of Tamriel! Abandoned by your former allies, you must work together with your fellow adventurers to defeat enemies, embark on intriguing quests and face the looming threat that seeks to destroy everything you swore to protect.

In this endlessly replayable game of branching quests and mysteries to uncover, you take on the role of a brave Adventurer, in co-op or solo adventures with hundreds of hours of gameplay. Build your unique character, upgrade your equipment, delve into dungeons and travel across the Holds of Skyrim. Gain experience, find treasures and battle Draugr, Daedra, Dragons and more. Play through six chapters of two hugely replayable campaigns spanning 25 years in the history of Tamriel.

INFO:
Author: Carlos Francisco Márquez
Illustrator: Rodolfo Serra
Publisher: MasQueOca
Release date:03/2010
Playing Age:14 and up
Number of players:1 - 4
Retail price:100 €
Playing time:180 minutes
Theme or setting:Second World War

As the Second World War raged across Europe, tensions brewed within the seemingly monolithic German war machine. Hitler, like dictators before him, had given his minions overlapping responsibility, so that they would plot against each other and keep him the arbiter. Germany’s military leadership worked well enough as Germany’s armies advanced in conquest after conquest. But Hitler's no retreat order in the difficult winter of 1941-1942 was a turning point in the way the war was run. All decisions now had to be approved from the top—a flagrant reversal of the German military tradition of setting objectives and giving subordinates freedom in how to attain them. As victory in the battle for Europe eluded the German generals and final defeat loomed, their competing agendas came ever more to the fore. Contravening their overseer, military leaders looked to a settlement with the Allies and, in a few cases, the end of the regime.

The Other Side of the Hill is a boardgame that simulates the effects that this struggle for power within the German High Command had on the development of the Second World War. Up to four players represent military leaders cooperating and competing as they manage Germany's wartime strategy. To win, they must vie for Prestige by advancing the careers of their favored Army and Army Group commanders, grabbing their share of victories while the early-war pickings are easy, then avoiding responsibility for battlefield disasters as the Soviets and the Western Allies solidify and push back.

Players will pursue hidden objectives to dominate the German Officer Corps on behalf of Interest Groups such as the technically-minded Professionals, a traditionalist Old Guard, or anti-Nazi Dissidents—all while Allied aircraft bombard Germany’s war industry and Allied armies press in on every front. As in history, players must reconcile contradictory roles. The German General Staff’s job is to hold the Allies off, but each clique’s priorities can subvert any collective strategy. And beware: a player may in secret be sabotaging the war effort!

The Other Side of the Hill offers competition for two, three, or four players as well as fully cooperative, semi-cooperative, and solitaire modes. Playing cards include intriguing historical details on World War Two’s real-life German Generals, strategic Directives, wartime Events, and personalities of the “Black Orchestra” plot to assassinate Hitler. Experience the European Theater of WWII as you have never gamed it before—from The Other Side of the Hill!

Game modes
• Competitive: One player will win, even if Germany falls before it historically did.
• Cooperative: Players win or lose together.
• Solo: You make all the decisions.
• Semi-Cooperative: If Germany falls before the historical date, everyone loses. Otherwise, one player wins.
• Campaign Mode: You can play the full campaign in successive shorter and more manageable gaming sessions.

Scenarios and Playtime
•The Triumph of Blitzkrieg (1939-1941): 3-4 hours
•The World Holds its Breath (1941-1942): 3-4 hours
•Point of No Return (1942-1943): 3-4 hours
•Festung Europa (1943-1944): 3-4 hours
•The Decline of the 3rd Reich(1943-1945): 4-5 hours.
•Total War (1942-1945): 5-6 hours
•World War (1941-1945): 8-10 hours
•Armageddon (1939-1945): 10-15 hours

¡You can play this game also in Vassal and TTS!
S_ORDER: THE OTHER SIDE OF THE HILL
TITEL: The Other Side of the Hill

Theme or setting:Freely inspired by the popular literary work ‘Journey to the West’

Peach Festival is freely inspired by the popular literary work ‘Journey to the West’, one of the greatest classic Chinese novels, which was published in the 16th century.

All players use the same dice roll to make their decisions. Their objective is to place ascending numbers within commodity columns in order to score points and create satisfying chain reactions.

During each turn 5 custom Commodity dice are rolled. Then, players may choose one of the following options:

  • Take Commodities: Obtain commodities according to the dice rolled, possibly manipulating them by eating Peaches of Immortality

or

  • Take a Peach

By obtaining commodities, players unlock special column or market rewards. When completing a column, players may obtain new Request cards showing fantasy characters of the novel (they represent game end objectives) or hire valuable Merchants.

Author: Richard Berthold & Robert Haines
Illustrator: Diego Lafuente
Publisher: MasQueOca
Release date:03/2010
Playing Age:14 and up
Number of players:1 - 6
Retail price:00 €
Playing time:300 minutes
Theme or setting:Roman Republic

The Republic of Rome Remastered is a game of negotiation, power and betrayal that simulates the 250 years of history between the First Punic War (264 B.C.) and the Civil War that followed the assassination of Julius Caesar (44 B.C.)

Each player will lead a political faction which includes senators from the most prominent families in the Republic. Players will compete against each other for government positions, economic concessions, control of the armies, and to attract new members to their faction, all with the ultimate goal of becoming the dominant political faction in Rome. Players will not only have to contend with each other, but also with the game itself, as Rome will be in constant danger. All players will lose the game if wars are not properly managed, if discontent turns into popular revolt, or if the Republic goes bankrupt. At the same time, players will have to cooperate closely to push through laws to manage internal politics and preserve social peace, declare wars to expand the borders of the Republic, or confront enemies who seek to destroy Rome. They will also have to compromise to attend to the recreational and religious needs of the people, purge the corrupt from office, and much, much more.

Thus, in order to win the game, players will need to balance service to Rome with personal gain. Usually, the faction with the most total influence will win the game, if Rome prevails. However, if a single senator stands out individually, he may aspire to become Dictator for life and achieve victory for his faction. The most dramatic and difficult path to victory is to revolt against the senate to seize power by force of arms.

This is an all-new edition that builds on the original and adds many new features that will make The Republic of Rome a fresh experience both for old and new players. These are the most relevant new features inThe Republic of Rome Remastered:

  • All the typos and inconsistencies in the previous edition have been corrected, and some rules that slowed down or overcomplicated gameplay have been streamlined.

  • The game’s graphic design has been entirely reworked, including new illustrations for all the game components.

  • For the first time, miniature busts are included to represent the main political offices in the game, while the option of using tokens is maintained for those who prefer them.

  • The board has been fully redesigned to reduce the demand for table space, and all tables will be moved to a Play Aid for the Herald of the senate.

  • New Event cards have been added and some of the existing ones have been modified. Additionally, a new Fate deck has been introduced to help balance Event results.

  • The influence of games and religious affairs in the Republic has been emphasized.

  • The rules have been completely rewritten and numerous examples have been added to facilitate learning and playing the game. In addition, a Playbook has been included with extended examples of play.

  • A set of new optional rules has been developed to mitigate the influence of luck during the game.

We are also working on a new solitaire mode to streamline solo gameplay and on the introduction of improved bots for 2- and 3-player games. All this and much more awaits you in The Republic of Rome Remastered!

In the world of Zavandor, various races, such as humans, elves, fairies and goblins, live in harmony. There was once a time of great war, but now they live in peace. However, Zavandor is still a dangerous world, where fearsome dragons and foul-smelling undeads exist. People live in constant fear of the massive volcano that could erupt at any moment. Author: Gerardo Maria Priore
Illustrator: Gerardo Maria Priore
Publisher: Beyond Words Games by Gerardo Maria Priore
Release date:11/2024
Playing Age:14 and up
Number of players:3 - 7
Retail price:6 €
Playing time:45 minutes
Theme or setting:Bizarre

Induction Logic/3-7/45min/14+

THIS IS A WEIRD ONE And nope... we don't mean the art... but the mechanics.

The Strange Forgeries Of Mr. S.C.Rheber is a drawing game, but don't underestimate it -> this ain't no party game, but a logic puzzle that will rack your brain. In fact one player will cover an unconventional role—crafting a rule of the game!

Here 2-6 players (the Collectors) will purchase art from their Gallerist. However some of the paintings are fakes crafted by the talented forger Simon Charles Rheber. The Collectors will master their inductive reasoning to determine which painting is one of the strange forgeries of Mr. S.C.Rheber.

During the game, 2-6 Collectors will produce many drawings, and one Gallerist will secretly tell them whether it follows the secret rule that they had invented at the beginning of the game, aka whether the drawings are Originals or Fakes. At the end of the game, the Collectors will put their knowledge to the test, and try to guess whether their opponents' displayed drawings follow the rule or not. Mistakes determine the winner, so they’ll want to try to make as few as possible. So to win the game, it is more important to know the rule better than your opponents than to guess it.

The game includes 2 expansions that adds more strategy: the Art Critic, a semi-coop, and the Inspector a fully competitive GM-vs-all variant.
S_ORDER: THE STRANGE FORGERIES OF MR. S.C.RHEBER
UNTERTITEL: Beyond Words Games by Gerardo Maria Priore
TITEL: The Strange Forgeries Of Mr. S.C.Rheber

The Vale of Eternity: Artifacts, an expansion for The Vale of Eternity, adds 28 creature cards with new effects to the deck, as well as artifacts that players draft during the hunting phase at the start of each round.

In more detail, at the start of a round reveal twice as many creatures as players in the usual way, then starting with the first player, each player drafts an artifact without their marker on it by placing their marker on that artifact. (In effect, you can't draft the same artifact you had the previous round.) Some artifacts have instant effects you use immediately, others give you a permanent effect that entire round, and others grant you an action that you can use once on a turn. After drafting artifacts, players draft creature cards in the usual way.

When using artifacts, the victory threshold for the game is now 80 points instead of 60, although the game still ends after ten rounds regardless of the score.

The year is 1130. An assembly is about to be called to elect a new chieftain of your Viking village. There is only one opponent who could threaten your election. Over the next few days you must balance your time between the clans and the Thingstead (where the elders are gathered) in order to ensure the votes go to you instead of your rival. At the end of the game, the elders of the Thingstead call a vote and decide a winner.

The battle for power has begun. Who will the Seven Elders choose to be the next Chieftain? Manage your hand of cards, play them wisely and win your place as leader of the tribe without dealing a single blow of the axe!

Players take turns completing one action at a time. The eldest player goes first. Available actions are:

A. PLAY A CARD TO THE THINGSTEAD TO INFLUENCE AN ELDER
B. PLAY A CARD TO A CLAN TO GAIN FOLLOWERS AND SPECIAL POWERS

After a player plays their card, they draw another one from the face-up row of 3 cards, or from the top of the draw deck. Then it is the opposing player’s turn.

Game continues until one of the following conditions is fulfilled:

One Player has locked 3 Elders or the draw deck is empty and both players are out of cards.

To calculate the final score, players add up the points gained from influencing Elders and for each Clan they control.

The player with the most points is the winner! In the case of a tie, the player with the most Followers among the Elder cards wins.

What happens when Roberto Fraga and David Bonifacy try to create a trivia game?

We’re not entirely sure, but This Is Not a Trivia Game!

This Is Not a Trivia Game! is a competitive game for the whole family, blending a little bit of knowledge, a lot of common sense, and above all, speed. 

Each question comes with four possible answers. The first player to choose the correct answer wins a point. But be careful: you'll see the answers before the question!

Stay sharp! This game is packed with traps, surprises and questions that are more than what they seem.

Well…. who knows… maybe this is a trivia game after all!

It's the era of discoveries! The British Empire needs to find new naval trade routes to Asia, so it launches numerous expeditions to the Arctic in order to find The Northwest Passage. In Through Ice and Snow, you and your friends will travel through the Arctic and compete to become the most prestigious explorer by documenting species, mapping treacherous lands, and discovering the elusive Northwest Passage.

As the expedition progresses, new map pieces and routes will be revealed and added to the modular board. Each player is in command of their own ship, and the crews include three officers with individual skills: - The Carpenter, a craftsman who provides upgrades and structures - The Scientist, a scholar who provides inventions and research - The Captain, an officer who provides leadership and organization. You can also recruit Inuit, exceptional guides expert in finding fuel, improving sleds, and leading vital hunting parties. Each journey involves unique challenges and events that your crews must face: Those Arctic expeditions faced many tragedies, as finding food was extremely difficult, overworked crews were prone to mutiny, and the weather was merciless. Triumph and you will be immortalized. If you fail, you will be lost in the ice forever.

Author: Fernando Eduardo Sánchez

Illustrator: Pedro A. Alberto

Author: Fernando Eduardo Sánchez
Illustrator: Pedro A. Alberto

Theme or setting:naval, exploration, expedition, arctic, XIX century, Great Britain, Canada, Nunavut, Inuit, Amundsen

This expansion includes 4 additional modules for Through Ice And Snow base game:

Walking on Ice: The long winters were the greatest enemies of the explorers who sought the Northwest Passage. On many occasions, they were so harsh and long-lasting that the ice formed in Arctic waters did not melt during the summer season, forcing crews to decide whether to remain immobile for another year or to dedicate all their resources to breaking the thick ice sheets, risking that these efforts might be unproductive... There was also a third and desperate possibility: abandoning the ships and continuing on foot, either towards the final objective or towards southern lands that would allow them to save their lives. But this had to be the last option, as the bad weather that had rendered their ships useless would hit them hard during their long journey to salvation, weakening them physically and psychologically... and moreover, if they survived, the admirals would be court-martialed upon their return for abandoning the ships.

Inuit Mythology: Explorers and Ships: This is a module where explorers and their ships appear for the first time, to enhance the game experience.

Two new Solo Scenarios, including:

-Inuit Territory: The crew members are falling ill as we sail. Only the Inuit tribes from different areas are capable of finding solutions for the crew to heal. These healing methods are varied: from feeding certain animals to the sick to visiting distant Inuit on their same island to get a home remedy. We have to cross the Northwest Passage before the entire crew falls ill!

-Amundsen: We are aboard the Gjøa, a small ship that surely gives us facilities to cross the icy waters of the Arctic, although its size can also bring some problems: the number of provisions is smaller, as well as its fuel capacity... We are under the command of explorer Roald Amundsen, a Norwegian with less experience in polar waters than other explorers who previously perished pursuing our same objective. The crew knows this, and that's not good for morale! Let's hope his discipline guides us towards the conquest of our goal: to be the first to cross the Northwest Passage by ship.
S_ORDER: THROUGH ICE AND SNOW: MYTHS AND LEGENDS
TITEL: Through Ice And Snow: Myths And Legends

Mit Würfelglück und Planungsgeschick zum Sieg:

Tic Tac Town kombiniert simple Regeln mit leicht taktischem Spiel. Durch die gemeinsame Würfelauslage ist ein hoher Grad an Interaktion vorprogrammiert - also perfekt für den nächsten Spieleabend! Zusätzlich wird ganz nebenbei das Zahlenverständnis trainiert.

Besondere Eigenschaften:

+ Über 70 Aufgabenkarten: Mit drei verschiedenen Kategorien und unterschiedlichen Schwierigkeitsgraden wird jede Runde spannend und abwechslungsreich.

+ Kaum Wartezeit beim Spielen: Schnelle Züge und direkte Interaktion sorgen dafür, dass niemand lange warten muss.

+ Beidseitig nutzbares Spielfeld: Für zusätzliche Abwechslung und Spieltiefe.

+ Einfache Regeln gepaart mit leicht taktischem Spiel: Perfekt für Spieler aller Altersgruppen.

So wird's gespielt:

Würfeln und platzieren: Alle Würfel werden gewürfelt. Reihum sucht sich jede Person einen Würfel aus und platziert ihn auf dem gemeinsamen Spielbrett.

Aufgaben erfüllen: Auf der Hand halten alle Aufgabenkarten, die gewisse "Würfel-Formationen" auf dem Brett fordern. Wird eine Aufgabe erfüllt, kann die Karte ausgespielt und gewertet werden.

Punkte sammeln: Sobald alle Würfel platziert wurden, sammeln alle ihre erfüllten Aufgabenkarten als Punkte, ziehen neue Aufgabenkarten nach und beginnen eine neue Runde.

Zusätzliche Details:

Augenzahlen und Farbkombinationen: Die Augen der Würfel müssen bestimmte Kombinationen und Gleichungen erfüllen, um Aufgaben zu lösen. Dies fördert nicht nur strategisches Denken, sondern auch das Zahlenverständnis.

Vielseitigkeit der Aufgaben: Aufgaben können sich auf die Augenanzahl, Farbformationen oder spezielle Gleichungen beziehen, was die Spieler immer wieder vor neue Herausforderungen stellt.

You landed your dream internship; working for professor Darwina Anning at the Time Zoo. The zoo filled with prehistoric animals is about to open when disaster strikes and all animals escape! It’s up to you to lure them back to the Time Zoo.

The animals all have different properties and are also worth points at the end of the game. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner and will receive the highest internship allowance from Professor Anning.

When the big clock strikes twelve, the gardens close, and you score extra points for having collected card sets as well as for your placement in 5 different races. E.g. who has tried the most ‘daredevil’ rides? The player with the most points wins.

In the heart of Copenhagen, you will find Tivoli. The beautiful amusement park is one of the oldest in the world. Inside the magical gardens, trees, flowers, and hundreds of thousands of colored lights welcome you to a world of wonder, exciting rides, balloons, and delicious treats.

Age of Tyranny: Der Kampagnen-Modus ist eine Erweiterung für Too Many Bones.

Dunkelheit ist über Daelore hereingebrochen. Sieben Tyrannen haben eine Invasion begonnen, um das Land zu unterwerfen und zu terrorisieren – und der Rat der Gearlocs verlangt, dass ihr diese Bedrohung abwendet. Der Weg wird mühsam und voller Prüfungen sein. Er wird euch an eure Grenzen bringen und Narben hinterlassen.

Mit Age of Tyranny könnt ihr die einzelnen Too Many Bones-Abenteuer zu einer übergreifenden Kampagne verbinden. Das Ziel: Alle 7 Tyrannen besiegen.

Jedes Abenteuer bleibt eine einzelne Partie. Wenn ihr es schafft, den Tyrannen in der vorgegebenen Anzahl Tage zu besiegen, seid ihr erfolgreich und die Kampagne geht weiter. Haltet Fortschritte mit der Speichermatte fest. Seid ihr nicht erfolgreich? Dann endet die Kampagne.

Die Epilog-Karten und Kampagnen-Karten fügen neue Herausforderungen hinzu. Durch Narben müsst ihr gewohnte Strategien neu anpassen, während Vorteile euch das Spiel erleichtern.

Besonders beliebt sind auch die je 7 neuen Karten für Tag 1 bis 3, mit denen ihr den Start in eure Abenteuer noch abwechslungsreicher gestalten könnt.

Tink ist eine Gearloc-Erweiterung für Too Many Bones. Sie bringt einen neuen Charakter mit dazugehöriger Charakter-Matte und 21 Würfeln. Sie bringt spannende Mechaniken und ganz neue taktische Möglichkeiten.

Es geht doch nichts über die Ingenieurskunst der Gearlocs! Tink mag klein und zerbrechlich sein, aber seine Krabbler sind es nicht. Baue überlegene Bots und statte sie mit mächtigen Technologien aus – oder wirf nem Fiesling deinen Schraubenschlüssel an den Kopf! Bleib immer schön hinter deinen Krabblern und lass sie die Klopperei für dich übernehmen … wie sagt man so schön: Warum Selbermachen, wenn andere es machen können?

Tink gilt zwar als einer der komplexesten Gearlocs, aber wenn man mal seine Tricks und Tücken durchschaut hat, macht er dafür umso mehr Spaß.

Theme or setting:Caps, Pubs

In Top Cap, each player starts with four bottle caps in their color on a 6x6 grid; the corner of the grid closest to them depicts a bottle in the matching color.

On a turn, choose one of your bottle caps, count the number of bottle caps of either color that are on adjacent spaces (whether orthogonal or diagonal), then move that bottle cap exactly that many spaces in a straight line either diagonally or orthogonally. You cannot leave the board, jump or land on a bottle cap, or land on your bottle.

If you move one of your bottle caps onto the opponent's bottle, you win. If you cannot legally move one of your bottle caps on your turn, you lose.

From time to time, sprightly spirits are seen jumping around. When these playful beings appear, miracles occur, and the village often flourishes from their harmless pranks. Over time, the villagers become followers, and magnificent Torii gates are erected, allowing people to worship the spirits and express their gratitude.

In Torii, players become two playful spirits. On their turn, they choose an action tile to move 1, 2, or 3 steps and spread their followers. When the followers form a line, a Torii is built. What’s tricky is that the two spirits will never see each other; they must always jump over the line where the other spirit is present.

Plan your moves ahead to block the opponent spirit from going where they want. Or, simply move and see how the other spirit reacts!

  • A breezily fresh yet challenging abstract game. Play in 10-20 minutes.

  • Features a dual-layer board and wooden Torii gates. Six spirits per player provide a unique experience each game.

Authors: Rachel Rusk, Stephen Louis, Tony Mayer
Illustrators: Rachel Rusk, Stephen Louis, Tony Mayer
Publisher: Frosted Games, Panic Roll
